That wasn't a problem for me, but just be aware in case you are ordering this as a gift for someone. The castle does require some assembly, but it's pretty easy. The play set is durable. It comes with Anna & Elsa figures. This would be fun for a young Frozen fan.

title: Fun Mega Bloks
text: These Paw Patrol Mega Bloks are lots of fun. It comes with one character (Chase the police dog) and 2 vehicles - a police cruiser and a motorcycle. The item are fairly easy to assemble. These are the larger blocks geared toward 3 year old and up. The price point makes it a good gift.

title: Paw Patrol Stamps
text: This rubber stamp kit is a Paw Patrol themed kit. It has 16 wood mounted rubber stamps. The rubber area is not trimmed, which causes the edges to stamp as well as the image if you're not careful pressing on the stamps. Most kids will probably use more of a rocking motion when stamping which does result in those stray marks from the edge getting on their paper. The wood blocks are comfortable to hold. The images are adequate and stamp well. The ink pad and markers are okay. They're not high quality supplies, but they're good enough for kids. This is a decent set and would make a fun gift for a young Paw Patrol fan.

title: Realistic
text: I love this new Barbie! This is Brooklyn from the Big City Big Dreams line. She works in a music studio. She is very realistic, especially when compared to the traditional Barbie. She's curvy and has braids. She even has beautiful edges! She comes with accessories that a young woman might need in the music studio. She's definitely a positive role model!

title: Cute Rainbow Dog
text: This is a cute rainbow plush dog. It's very soft and seems to be made well. It's not what I would consider a super high end plush, but it's definitely nicer than what you would win at the carnival. There's a velcro opening on the dog's back which I thought might have voice/sounds box or some other kind of surprise, but it just leads to the filling. I thought that was odd. Other than that, it's a fine stuffed toy.

title: Batteries Included
text: This Paw Patrol hand held learning phone comes with batteries, so it's ready to play. The screen size is small and the graphics are pixelated. There are a few games to play that mostly involve math skills. It should keep young Paw Patrol fans busy for a while!

title: No Puzzle Dust
text: I have never been much of a puzzle person, but as with many others, I started completing them during the pandemic. Now I am a puzzle person! I was attracted to this puzzle by the beautiful image. It's colorful and vibrant. Plus, it's gorgeous illustration. The puzzle itself is a good quality. It's challenging but not impossible. One thing I did notice was that there was no puzzle dust! It also includes a mini poster of the image which is much easier to handle than the box lid when working on the actual puzzle.

title: Lots of Art Supplies!
text: This set contains a lot of art supplies! The quality of the items is decent. They're not professional grade by any means, but they're good and definitely acceptable. There's a nice variety of supplies. It comes with an activity book, but I think it would be nice to have an art pad of paper, too. Everything stores in a wooden storage unit. The whole thing is surprisingly heavy! It comes in a nice gift bag, ready to go!

title: Fun Doll Set
text: This Hairdorables Hairmazing Prom Perfect doll set is a lot of fun. It comes with 2 dolls - Neila and Logan. They're just a teeny bit shorter than the average Barbie. The pair is dressed for prom. The dolls are jointed so you can arrange their positions. The left side of the packing turns into a play set and even includes a dance floor! There are also some surprise accessories to go with them. At first I thought it was kind of blind box experience, but the accessories are all pictured in the description and they're the same ones we got. So I assume they just wanted to make it special and fun. This would make a great gift!

title: Much Nicer Than Expected!
text: This is a cute and wonderful stuffed teddy bear. He's super soft. The details are excellent. He seems to be well made, too. He is much nicer than expected. This is not the type of stuffed toy you would get in the claw machine, that's for sure!

title: New Twist to a Classic Toy
text: Wooden blocks are making a comeback! This is a new twist to a classic toy. The tie in with the popular Paw Patrol show is a fun way to help young kids with letter recognition, shapes, numbers, and more. There are multiple ways to play. The truck and blocks are sturdy and durable. This is a quality toy that will last!

title: Fun Set
text: This is a fun set for any Paw Patrol fan! The vehicles and figures are sturdy, wooden pieces. It includes paint, brushes, and stickers for decorating. I really like that the stickers are included. You can choose to paint the figures, but from my experience, kids may get a little frustrated that theirs may not look like the real deal. With the stickers, they are guaranteed that their figures look just like the real Paw Patrol characters. As for the vehicles, those are easier to paint and it's not quite as worrisome if they don't exactly match. But with the addition of some of the stickers, they look pretty good. Kids will feel accomplished for creating their own play set! This would make an ideal gift for young children (preschool range).

title: Great Image! Great Quality
text: I love Dowdle puzzles! They are the best!! The images are kind of folk artsy. There is so much detail to discover while assembling it. The quality of the pieces is excellent. I've had several Dowdle puzzles and I've never had peeling or split pieces. The puzzle comes with a fold out poster which is so much easier to refer to than the box lid. I highly recommend!

title: Excellent Quality!
text: This stuffed dog is super cute. And it's an excellent quality, too. This is NOT a carnival grade stuffed animal. This is a high end, department store type quality. The features are well done. The dog is really soft. He would make a great gift for any child.

title: Great for Younger Kids!
text: This Blue Clues & You handle stamp set by Melissa & Doug is a great activity set for younger kids. The set comes with rubber stamps, ink pads, crayons, and some activity sheets. The rubber stamps have large wooden handles which are easy for small hands to grip. The ink pads are large enough that the stamps fit in it easily and allows the user to ink the rubber well. This is really a nice quality set. It would make an excellent gift.

title: Dowdle Puzzle
text: Dowdle puzzles are my favorite puzzles! They are excellent in quality. The pieces are sturdy. There was only minimal puzzle dust, if any, because I didn't notice it. The picture is gorgeous! It's fun to see all of the animals and people. These puzzles always include a pull out poster which is easier to refer to than the box lid. They also include a zipper style plastic bag for storage. I like this smaller, 300 piece size. It's not as daunting as the 1000 piece ones.

title: Great Educational Toy
text: This is a great educational toy. It comes with batteries, though it's recommended that you replace since they were designed for demo purposes. The toy has a handle which makes it easy to carry. There's a volume control which should please all parents! There are a couple of different modes or levels of play. It is a great way to introduce the ABC's and their sounds to young children.

title: Nostalgic!
text: My husband and I are graduates from Indiana University, so it was exciting to see this puzzle! We saw many basketball games at Assembly Hall, so this is very nostalgic for us. It is a difficult puzzle. The pieces are small, but they are sturdy enough. There's a lot of red and white which makes it challenging. We have been working on it for a few days now and I can tell it's going to be several more days before we finish. The overall quality of the puzzle is good. There wasn't too much puzzle dust to get all over the table. The pieces are cut well. This would make a great gift for IU fans.

title: Huge!
text: My 23 year old son plays D&D regularly with his friends. None of them had a 100 die, so I thought it would be fun for them to have one. My son has been very impressed with it. It's huge! The largest dice in his collection. The skulls are barely noticeable which is kind of a fun surprise. It's not as heavy as you would expect. It was packed tightly in foam and a little difficult to remove from the case.

title: End Results are Great!
text: When I saw that there were light kits for some of the Lego kits,  I thought that was a neat idea. Most of the kits, however, were not for Lego sets that my family had. Then I saw the Boba Fett one that my 23 year old son had recently assembled, so I had to order it. It comes with an instruction booklet that shows you step by step with pictures. I assisted my husband with the task. You do have to take parts of the Lego masterpiece apart to do the job. The wires are very thin and once the job is finished, they're not very noticeable. They could have been completely hidden if we had run the first wire along the opposite side of the brick. Lesson learned. By the time we were finished, we were glad to be done and didn't want to go back and change it. The whole thing probably took less than 30 minutes. We were a little slow at times, trying to decipher the instructions to make sure that we were removing the correct piece and such. The actual lights have adhesive strips on them to keep them in place. You do have to plug the wire ends into a piece so everything is linked together. It requires 3 AAA batteries, not included. The end results are great! Our son was very pleased with how it looks.

title: Great for Pokemon Fans!
text: My college aged son is still a fan of Pokemon. He displays his Pokemon Mega Construx figures in his room on  shelves. These are all little pokeballs with various Pokemon. They are fun to put together. The quality is good. I wasn't familiar with the characters, but my son was. They're great for Pokemon fans of all ages!

title: Beautiful Puzzle
text: This Cat Lady of Porto puzzle is beautiful! The pieces are a good quality. I didn't notice any puzzle dust. The pieces come in a zippered bag which is very appreciated. The full image is on the inside of the box lid for your reference. It was a bit challenging. It seems like most if not all (except the border) pieces are the variations of the same shape. I tend to be really good at putting puzzles together by identifying the shape that goes into the space. It was more difficult since there isn't a lot of shape differences. Overall, it's a nice quality puzzle.

title: Huge!
text: I have wanted one of these outdoor Connect Four games to add to our backyard games. This is huge! It's larger than I expected. It reminds me of the little kids play equipment that my kids had when they were little  because of the bright colored plastic. I do like the carrying case that comes with it, but I wish it had more of a cover so I could leave it out on the patio but it would be protected from the elements. My husband suggested we just get a grill cover to put over it. The game works just as the smaller version. It is going to be a hit at our next cookout!

title: Such a Cute Blue!
text: The Bedtime Blue is such a cute Blue! She talks, well, she makes her well known Blues noises. The little Blue toy she's holding lights up. It plays a sweet lullaby. The quality of the stuffed Blue is very good. It's not some cheap stuffed toy. It does require batteries, but they're included!

title: Complete Set
text: My son used to love using his rock tumbler. He's in college now and recently discovered his old tumbler and wanted to start using it again. We had moved since he last used it and didn't have any grit for the job. This seems to be a complete set with a variety of grits for the various stages. If you've never tumbled rocks before, it's a long process. He started this almost two weeks ago. He's either on step 2 or 3 right now. He's been pleased with these supplies. He likes that the containers are wide enough to scoop directly out of the jar rather than having to pour. It's handy having all the step supplies together.

title: Two for the Price of One
text: You get 2 pool floats in this set. Each one has a mesh portion that has a small inflatable pillow on each end. The pillows are easy to inflate without any special air pump. With these, you're not floating on top of the water, rather you are actually in the water. You can lounge on it or sit in it. I'm a large plus size mom and while sitting in it, more than half of my body is submerged in the water. A lighter person might have less of their body submerged. There's not a lot to them, so I'm not sure how long they will last. I do think they would last at least through the end of this summer.

title: Great Details!
text: This doll house kit is really cool. It has lots of great details. It's not an activity that you can complete in an afternoon, rather it's one that will take some time. Step by step instructions are provided. The quality of the pieces is pretty good. This would be a great family project!

title: Fun Puzzle!
text: This children's book theme puzzle is fun! The illustrations bring back lots of fond memories. The puzzle is pretty good. The quality of the pieces is decent. I didn't see any peeling images. The pieces seem to be all the same shape. That makes it a bit more difficult. I'm really good at guessing the shape needed in a spot and I couldn't do that with this one because they're all the same, minus the border. There are letters on the back to help with placement. It did make it a little faster, especially with the sorting. Overall, I liked it.

title: Fun
text: This is a fun, political collectible. The bobblehead works as a bobblehead should. The details are good, but it does have a few spots where the paint wasn't applied well. He looks nice on my home office shelf!

title: A New Way to Play Hide & Seek
text: Hide & Seek was always one of my favorite games when I was a child. I liked the new twist to the game. The directions are pretty easy to understand. You hide the device, then activate it. It will make a beeping type sound (that's not too annoying). The frequency of the beeps and the sound strength can be changed depending on the level you select. It's obviously much easier to find it when it's loudly beeping every few seconds! It becomes more challenging when the volume is softer and the beeps are spaced out more. I thought this would be a fun game for my young adult children to play with their younger cousins. They had a blast! There are some other games you can play, too, such as Hot Potato & Simon. Batteries are not included.

title: Mini- Size
text: My friend and I have gotten into the miniature dollhouse craze. This one is labeled mini and is definitely smaller than most of the others that I have seen. Other than the difference in the size, it's pretty much the same. The pieces and material are included, it's up to you to make everything and put it all together. I have to use a special magnifying light because of all the small tiny details. It's a fun little hobby!

title: Acceptable
text: My son is a card collector. He primarily collects Magic the Gathering cards, but he's still fond of his Pokemon cards as well. He keeps a lot of his cards in protective sheets inside binders, but he uses these for the cards that he keeps in his decks. He finds these to be acceptable and work for his intended purposes.

title: Looks Good!
text: Today is my daughter's birthday. I wanted to make a nice balloon bouquet for her. Helium is so expensive these days and I don't really have time to go to the party supply store. This has enough supplies to make 2 sets of balloon bouquets. It comes with pictures/directions, but I found that wasn't easy to follow. I ended up looking up videos online and that's what helped the most. I am pleased with the end results. It looks good!

title: Party in a Box!
text: Today is my daughter's birthday. I ordered these for easy decorations. Helium balloons are so expensive these days so this party in a box doesn't involve a costly trip to the party supply store the day of the celebration. My husband used an electric air pump for the mylar letters. That worked pretty well. It didn't work on the latex balloons so we had to inflate them the old fashioned way by our selves. For the most part we were pleased with everything. There wasn't quite enough ribbon to hang the letters up. I broke it down into 2 separate strands, one "happy' and then below that "birthday" because it was too much for the wide doorway we were hanging them at. Had I kept it to one strand, it may have been enough curling ribbon. Also, one of the letters, must have a small leak in it because it kept partially deflating. It wasn't completely flat, but it was not as full as the others. I'm excited for my daughter to see all of the decorations!

title: Gorgeous Puzzle
text: This is a gorgeous puzzle! I love it! The pieces are a good thickness. There wasn't a massive amount of puzzle dust like some puzzles. The pieces connect well. I didn't see any pieces that had any peeling. The puzzle comes with a large poster of the image which makes me happy. It is so much easier to use a poster for reference rather than the box.

title: Artsy Cat Puzzle
text: What a fun puzzle! I love the artsy cat theme of it. The puzzle pieces are a decent size and thickness. I didn't notice any peeling pieces. There was minimal puzzle dust. The pieces fit well together. I love that it included a poster of the finished image. It's much easier to work from a poster than the box lid. This would make a great gift for cat lovers!

title: Nice Birthday Decorations
text: This is a nice set of birthday decorations. It comes with mylar balloons, a garland, and balloons. The garland does require some assembly, so keep that in mind and don't leave that for the last minute like I did. The decorations are festive. We were able to deflate a lot of the items so we can reuse them. They're not particularly sturdy, but with care, I think we can get a few more uses out of them. It does make it convenient having everything together.

title: Fun Little Kits
text: These are fun little kits. Each one is individually package with all the supplies needed for that project including a plastic needle. There are a few of each of the different type of projects, but each one is a different subject or color.

title: Awesome Puzzle!
text: This is an awesome puzzle! Perfect for cat lovers! The pieces are cut well. The sizing and thickness of the pieces is good. There was minimal puzzle dust. The picture is nice and clear. I love that it includes a poster of the image so you can refer to that while working on it. That's much easier than holding onto the box lid. This would make a great gift!

title: Just What I Wanted!
text: These mylar numbers are just what I wanted! They're easy to inflate and deflate with the provided straw. They're large and they look great! I taped these onto the wall for my daughter's birthday. After deflating them, I've hung onto them, but I can't foresee the need for the number "20" anytime soon. These are a fun way to celebrate special birthdays!

title: Fun Puzzle!
text: This is a fun cat/book themed puzzle. It comes with a poster of the image which is easier to use than the box lid. The pieces are average quality, but decent. There was minimal puzzle dust.

title: Great for Displaying Mini-Figs
text: This display case is an affordable way to show off your unique mini-figs. The case requires some assembly, but it's not difficult. The pieces are plastic and not very thick, but they are sturdy enough to do the job. If you plan to remove your mini-figs frequently, this may not be the best option, but if you want to display them, it works.

title: Adorable Puzzle!
text: I love cats and tend to gravitate towards cat themed things. This cat puzzle is adorable! The artwork is lovely. The pieces are pretty well cut out. There was just a minimal amount of puzzle dust. The thickness of the pieces is good. The puzzle doesn't include a poster so you do have to hold onto the box while you are working on it.

title: So Much Fun!
text: I ordered these STEM Discovery packs by Little Passports for my husband, son (23 years old) and nephew (10 years old) to do together. They've only done the marble one and the pinball one so far, but we're quite impressed with them! My husband and son took on the role of advisor while my nephew took lead of the projects. The instructions are clear and easy to follow. The materials are a good quality for the type of projects. They enjoyed reading the included comics together. I would say that the recommended age is accurate and the material is age appropriate. The projects led to some really interesting conversations between the 3 of them. These kits come nicely packaged and would make a great gift!

title: Best Crayola Assortment EVER!
text: This is the best Crayola assortment of crayons EVER! I love it! There are so many shades of skin tones. As a former teacher, I hated that there were so few options for skin tones. While this set may not have every possible skin color, it offers a large selection that most children will be able to find something close to their color. As for the quality, Crayola crayons are the best and these are as expected. I hope teachers everywhere make these available to their students!

title: Fun Cat Themed Puzzle
text: Most of the puzzles that I do are 1000 piece ones, but it's nice to have smaller ones every once in a while because it's faster to work them. This one is a good, small puzzle. I love the cat theme! The cats do repeat in the puzzle which makes it challenging. The pieces are cut well and I didn't notice any puzzle dust. I would like it if the puzzle came with a poster of the image. I find those to be helpful and easier to hold on to than the puzzle box lid. Overall, this is a fun puzzle!

title: I Can Puzzle More!
text: Because of this puzzle table, I can puzzle more! It's so easy to move that if I need my table space, it's no big deal to relocate it. I used to be hesitant to start a puzzle because that would mean that the table would be out of commission for a few days while I worked on it. That's not a problem any more! The puzzle table is a little heavy and bulky. You have to be careful carrying it through narrow doorways. The trays are nice for sorting. They can be completely removed if needed. I'm loving how useful this is!

title: Beautiful Dice
text: These are beautiful dice. My 23 year old son likes playing D&D. He has a few different sets of dice. He likes these because they are translucent. He's all about the looks when it comes to dice and these are sparkly and pretty.

title: Great Puzzle!
text: This is a great puzzle! The quality is very good. The pieces are cut well and there is minimal puzzle dust. No peeling edges were noticed. The image is colorful and sweet. This puzzle comes with a poster which is very helpful when it comes to assembly time. It's much easier to handle a poster than the box lid.

title: Gorgeous Dice Set
text: My 23 year old son gets together with his friends for gaming. He's not usually the DM, but he does like having his own dice. This is a gorgeous set of dice. They come in a sturdy storage bag. He really likes to impress his friends with his dice when they get together.

title: Challenging Puzzle
text: This is a challenging puzzle because of the small piece size. However, it's a wonderful puzzle image. I didn't notice much puzzle dust. It does come with a folded puzzle poster which is very helpful. All the pieces were intact. Overall, a really good puzzle.

title: Beautiful Puzzle
text: I've been to Barcelona, so I was excited to give this puzzle a try. A lot of the destination puzzles are places that I have never been to, so it's fun to do one of something you're actually familiar with. The pieces are pretty sturdy. There's minimal puzzle dust. I didn't see any peeling edges. One of my favorite puzzle feature is that there's a poster of the image so that's so much easier to deal with than the box lid. Overall, a good quality puzzle.

title: Beautiful Puzzle Image
text: This puzzle has a beautiful puzzle image. I love the positive and inspiring quotes and role models. I didn't notice the spelling error until I read it in the description. It is a shame that it has a mistake in it. The puzzle pieces are a good quality. I didn't see a whole of puzzle dust. Pieces are cut pretty well. It does not include a poster of the image so you do have to rely on the box lid.

title: Great Quality
text: This is a great quality of puzzle. I hardly saw any puzzle dust. The pieces are small, but sturdy. I didn't see any peeling  on any of the pieces. The subject and image is wonderful! It comes with a poster for reference which is so much easier to use than the box lid! This has been a fun puzzle to complete!

title: Great Assortment of Raw Stones!
text: My 23 year old son lives at home while he's attending college. He's always had an interest in rocks, stones, and crystals. He bought a rock tumbler many years ago and has recently started using it again. He was thrilled with this great assortment of raw stones! The rocks were all dusty and plain looking when we opened them. He saw the beauty potential in ones that looked super ordinary to me. The tumbling process takes quite a while, so we're not going to see any results in at least a couple of weeks. But my son was very pleased with the variety, size and quality of the rocks that received.

title: Beautiful Puzzle Image!
text: This is a beautiful puzzle! I love the artwork of the women. It's a nice mix of historically significant women, though I wasn't familiar with all of them. The quality of the puzzle is good. There was minimal puzzle dust. I didn't come across any pieces with peeling edges. I do appreciate it when a poster of the image is included, but this one does not have one, so I did have to use the box lid as I was working it.

title: Nerf-Fun!
text: This is a fun Nerf gun. It's fairly accurate and shoots a good distance. Rapid shooting. Batteries are required and not included. It also uses a different dart than most of the other Nerf weapons so they're not compatible with other Nerf guns unless they use the Ultra darts.

title: Great Nerf Gun
text: This is a dinosaur themed Nerf gun. It works really well. It's easy to operate and would be perfect for a younger player. It has storage for a few darts. The shooting range is decent and comparable to a lot of other Nerf guns. No batteries required!

title: Hefty Dice
text: My 23 year old son is a D&D fan. He also loves beautiful and unique dice. This set of dice comes in a metal tin packed with foam. The dice are quite hefty. The iridescent appearance is really fun! I personally found it a little challenging to read some of the sides, but my son doesn't seem to share that same issue. He is looking forward to his next gaming night.

title: Great Alternative to the Name Brand
text: My 23 year old son likes Nerf Guns. He likes to alter them (paint, etc) to make them look like weapons from various video games. He picks up many of his at the local Goodwill. Of course, those picked up at the thrift stores don't come with darts. And even if they did come with darts, they do tend to go missing. These foam darts work perfectly in the Nerf guns that he owns. He tried them in several different models and he couldn't tell the difference in their performance from the name brand ones. He even put them in the Nerf magazines and they worked just fine. In his opinion, these are a great alternative to the name brand foam darts.

title: Fun Puzzle Image
text: The year 2020 was the year I decided that I actually enjoy puzzles! I have never before really cared for them. Now, I regularly work on them. This one has a fun puzzle image. I like the collage "Across America" pictures. The quality of the puzzle is decent. The pieces are cut well and there was minimal puzzle dust. I haven't noticed any peeling corners . The image is colorful and clear. This puzzle does not include a full size poster of the image, which is a little disappointing. At my age, I find it's easier to hold the poster than the box lid. Overall, it's a good puzzle.

title: A Fun Project!
text: This is a fun project! I imagine it will take me a while to finish it, but so far, so good. The instructions are very detailed and include lots of diagrams and pictures to show you step by step how to assemble things. The translation to English is decent, but not great. However, I've been able to understand it. As far as I can tell, everything is included. There's even glue! I strongly recommend finding a place where you can leave this out until you're finished because there are so many pieces and parts.

title: Great Flash Cards!
text: My daughter is in college studying wildlife biology. She made a comment to me over the holiday break that she wanted to learn to identify animal tracks. When I saw this, I thought it would be perfect! While it is geared toward kids, there's nothing childish about it. It has some information about the animal tracks to help you distinguish between different animals. The tracks are not to size, but with larger animals, that would be not realistic. You'd have cards of all sizes! The quality of the cards is good. They're not flimsy by any means. There are 3 sets of cards. It  seems to be divided up into farm animals, woodland animals, and plains animals, though I may be incorrect on the actual groups, that's just my guess. This would be a great educational activity for kids of all ages!

title: Such Fun!
text: My sister was telling me about a similar kit that she was working on. Then I found out that my best friend was working on a kit like this. I had to get in on the fun! I am absolutely fascinated by them. The kit includes all the pieces to make the items in the garden coffee shop. The items are not pre-made so you're starting at the beginning. All the pieces are provided as well as good, detailed instructions. The instructions show you step by step how to make the pieces. The wording is a bit choppy at time, but I am able to get the gist of it. The pictures are helpful! Some tools are included, but I am using my own craft detail scissors that seem better than the ones provided. Glue is not provided either. My sister recommend craft glue which is what I'm using and it seems to be adequate. Patience is definitely required! It's fun watching this model set come to shape!

title: Cute Kitty Puzzle
text: I have completed more puzzles in the past year than I have in my entire life! I am a cat lover, so when I saw this sweet kitty puzzle, I was excited. The puzzle is a good quality. The dust was minimal. The pieces were cut well. I didn't notice any peeling of images. The grid design definitely makes it easier. There was no poster of the image included. With my aging eyesight, I really appreciate it when a puzzle does come with one. They're easier to work with than holding the box lid. Other than that, this is a fine puzzle.

title: Fun Deck of Cards
text: This is a fun deck of cards. The card quality is very good and comparable to most decks of cards. The images are clear. It has a nice variety of characters from the show. This would make a great gift for Outlander fans.

title: Wonderful Puzzle!
text: This is a wonderful puzzle. The pieces are a good quality. I didn't come across any pieces that had peeling edges. They are a decent thickness. The image is awesome! I love grid style puzzles like this one. The vintage western theme was a lot of fun. The puzzle included a poster of the image which is always a plus to me. I would recommend this puzzle.

title: What Fun!
text: I have never been much of a puzzle fan, but during the pandemic, I became one! I've had other puzzles in the similar style of a grid with multiple images. I have found that it's a little easier than one large image, though it is still challenging. The pieces are a little small, but not impossible. The images are clear and easy to see. I didn't have any pieces where the image was starting to come up. I do appreciate that it came with a poster of the finished image. I find it much easier to work from a poster than the box lid. I really enjoyed the retro romance comic covers!

title: Vibrant Puzzle
text: This is a very vibrant and colorful puzzle. It has been fun working on. The pieces are a good quality. I didn't come across any pieces with peeling edges. A good sized poster of the image was included. I really prefer it when puzzles do this because it's easier to work from the poster than a box lid. I would definitely recommend this puzzle.

title: Fun Pixar Toy
text: My family absolutely loves Pixar movies. They are favorites for sure! These Interactable figures are pretty cool. By pushing a button on the front of the figure, the figure starts talking. If you have another figure and they're facing one another, the 2 figures will talk back and forth. From my playing with them, it seems like there's a pattern of 3 phrases/lines. Figure one says something, then figure two replies, then the first figure says something back. Then just push one of their buttons to keep them talking. There is some repeating of phrases, but never during the three phrases or lines during that button push. Sometimes the characters reply with a logical comeback and others seem totally random. There is usually one line that will call the other figure by name. The figures can be posed. Mr. Incredible's voice is spot on. He can stand up, but he gets knocked over easily. I am looking forward to the release of more Pixar figures!

title: The Sky's the Limit
text: This is basically a blank card game waiting for you to use your creativity. This comes with a few pre-made cards and hundreds of blank ones. The cards are larger than traditional cards. They are glossy and a bit flimsy, but not that different from regular cards as far as the thickness and quality. Because they are glossy, I recommend using Sharpies to write on. It gives you some guidance for starting the game, but it will quickly change from that intention as you make up your own cards/rules. The are 2 extra packs of over 300 blank cards each as well as many blank ones in the box. It's a chance to let your silliness shine!

title: Great Barbie Playset!
text: My daughter is past the Barbie stage (she's in college now), but I couldn't resist getting her this Barbie play set. This is Wilderness Guide Barbie. My daughter is studying Fisheries and Wildlife and wants to work with animals. So I have decided, this Barbie is her! In addition to Barbie, there are at 10 creatures, plus a couple of habitats. This play set will inspire girls who love animals to do what they love.

title: Beautiful Puzzle!
text: I must admit, I misread the information on this puzzle. I was drawn to the beautiful bird images! I thought it was a 1000 piece puzzle, so you can imagine my surprise when I opened it and noticed it was only 100 pieces. Nonetheless, it's a beautiful puzzle. It was refreshing to finish a puzzle so quickly! The pieces are labeled on the back for sorting purposes, but I didn't need it. I am saving this for my 7 year old niece who loves puzzles. The puzzle pieces are large and fairly thick. The overall quality is excellent.

title: Fun Pixar Toy
text: This Pixar Interactable Jessie Talking Action Figure is a lot of fun. Jessie comes dressed in her traditional cowgirl attire. Her hat is removable. She has a button on her front side that when pushed, causes her to spew out phrases. Her voice sounds like the movies, so I would assume it's the same actress. If you have another Interactable toy, you put the two so they are facing each other. Then press one of their buttons. They will have a conversation of 3 phrases/lines. They do correctly refer to each other by name. The phrases don't always jive together. For example, Jessie might say something about going to save the critters and then the other Buzz says my name is Buzz Lightyear. Sometimes they do make more sense and sound logical. Regardless, they're fun to play with. They do stand up on their own, but without any stands, they are likely to fall down easily. I am looking forward to more figures coming out!

title: Great for New Players!
text: My son has been playing MTG for several years now. He is a college student and spends a lot of his own money on cards. While none of the cards were particularly valuable or exciting to him, as a seasoned collector, he does think that the assortment he received was worth the listed price. The description of the rares/colors is accurate. He says that this would be great for new players.

title: Simple
text: This is a simple birthday garland/banner. It does require assembly, but it isn't difficult. The weight of the letters is average - it's not super heavy duty, but I think it will be good for a while. The letter on top had some weird markings on it.  It looks like small punctures. It was only on the top/first letter. I've included some pictures. I would have been angry if I had purchased it myself. It comes with thin curling ribbon to string the letters. I chose to make it into one long banner and hung it in the wide entrance to our living room for my son's birthday. It does look festive, even if it is pretty basic. I plan to save it and use it for other family birthdays.

title: Fun for Pixar Fans
text: My family absolutely loves Pixar movies and their characters. I thought these would be fun to have on a shelf in my office. The figure talks right out of the box, so there's no need to locate batteries before you start playing with it. There is a button on Frozone's chest that you can press to start talking. The voice has to be the real voice of the character.  If you have another figure from the Interactables line, then they will interact with one another. They have to be facing each other to talk. Some of the phrases seem to be perfect responses, but some do not. They do call each other by name  when conversing. I found that when you press one of the figures to activate, the one that was pushed will say a line. Then the other one replies or responds back. Then the original one says one more line. I have tried that with a few different figures and that applies to all of them that I have tried. Just press one of the buttons at the end of the 3rd phrase and they'll continue with another 3 responses. I do wish that the figures came with stands. They can stand up on a table or shelf, but they're not particularly stable and if you bump the surface, they'll fall down. So far I have been having a lot of fun with these! I can't wait until they release some more characters!

title: Easy Decorating!
text: Overall, I was quite pleased with this set of 2021 party decorations. It really makes for easy decorating. The numbers are nice and big. There was no string to hang the numbers, so luckily I had some curling ribbon that did the job. There was also no straw included to help with inflating. I started using one of my own straws for the task, but my husband saw me struggling with that and got out the small power inflator that we used to use with the pool toys and that sped things up. In addition to the number set, there are a few star mylar balloons and some traditional latex ones. (I think they're latex, but I'm not certain). Of those additional balloons, at least 3 of the them did not inflate due to holes. Besides the balloons, there are some spiral pieces for hanging. I did think it was odd that the plastic hanger pieces were not installed and we had to do that ourselves. It was not difficult, but any other time I have had similar swirl/spiral decorations, they've already had the hangers on them. We're staying home for the New Year's celebration, but it is a bit festive having the decorations up. Plus, we're excited to say good bye to 2020!

title: So Cute!
text: These outfits fit the American Girl dolls nicely. The assortment of outfits is super cute! They are made well, too. This is a great way to get a large variety of outfits for your doll at an affordable price. The outfits are individually packaged inside the bag, so if you wanted to, you could easily split them up to give to multiple recipients.

title: Well Thought Out
text: We just finished playing the game. It was my husband, 2 college kids (ages 19 & 22) and myself. My son, the 22 year old is a big gamer. He does play D&D, but for a while, he was majoring in game design. He even took a few classes at the college level until switching to IT.  The quality of the physical game is good. Everything is made well and looks engaging. We put my son in charge of the game and our DM. I started to get the game set up, but gave up quickly. The instructions are a few pages, but there were many things that we felt weren't covered adequately. My son thought a few more pages in the instruction manual would have been helpful. When we finished our game play, we did notice on the bottom of the box, it says "FAQs and more details about the cards can be found at www.....) That would have been nice to know before hand. We did run a few races. It was okay, but we felt that we were struggling with it. We did feel that there was potential. We're going to sit on it for a while and try again in a few weeks now that we have a better understanding.

title: Colorful!
text: This puzzle is colorful and has lots of fun details. The pieces are a good quality. I haven't noticed any peeling pieces or poorly printed images. It came with minimal dust. While geared toward younger puzzlers, my 19 year old daughter enjoyed reminiscing while working on this.

title: Beautiful Folk Art Style Puzzle
text: This is a beautiful folk art style puzzle. It reminds me of Dowdle puzzles which I really like. The pieces are wooden. The backs are labeled and there are dividers so you can separate all the pieces to help with the speed of putting it together. I personally have never done a puzzle that way, but it's a nice option to have. It does come with a poster of the image. I think all puzzles should include a folded poster of the image. It really helps when putting the puzzle together. This is the first time I have ever considered complaining about the poster, but this poster is not only huge, it's also printed on paperboard so it's stiff and sturdy. It can be folded, but I think it's a little too much. I'm happy with just a regular poster. I do appreciate that it comes with it! The puzzle is very nice and I look forward to sharing this with a friend now that I have completed it.

title: Excellent Puzzle!
text: I just finished this puzzle and I can't find anything negative about it. The pieces are a good size and thickness. I didn't see any peeling pieces. There wasn't a lot of puzzle dust. It came with a folded poster of the image which I really appreciate. It's easier to hold the poster than the box lid. I was a little overwhelmed at first, but once I started working on it, I found that it was easier to distinguish the creatures than I thought. I found it to be a very enjoyable and satisfying puzzle.

title: Love the Image!
text: I love the image of this 500 piece puzzle. I was unfamiliar of the artist and this painting. It's really a beautiful piece of work. The puzzle quality is good. There were lots of hanging "chads". Several of the pieces had pieces of thin cardboard stuck in the crevices which had to be removed. The thickness of the pieces is good. I just think that they weren't cut all the way through. The puzzle does not have a poster included. I really appreciate it when there is one because it's easier to use as reference than the box lid. I was able to complete the puzzle in a couple of days.

title: Great Idea!
text: What a great idea! Kids are notorious for not washing their hands often, so give them some slime! The jars are small therefore  there's not a whole lot of slime to work with. The consistency is slime-like and what one would expect. It's a tad sticky at first, but that goes away pretty quickly. I like the assortment of colors. This would make a fun stocking stuffer!

title: Enjoyable
text: This was an enjoyable puzzle. I really liked the map. Each state has the image of something that pertains to that state. The pieces are average quality. I didn't notice any peeling images. There was no poster included which was a disappointment. At my age, it's easier to hold a poster of the puzzle image to work with than to hold on to the box lid.

title: Fun Food Shapes
text: This is a fun advent calendar. Each day you get a new item to build. I like that the bricks are compatible with the name brand ones. That makes them useful after the holidays. These are all food items that you don't normally make with these type of bricks. They're mostly flat and 2-D, but they're fun nonetheless.

title: Cute!
text: Eevee has always been a favorite Pokemon at my house. This interactive one is small but responds to touch and sound. It makes lots of different sounds and movements. The majority of the sounds are squeaks which I'm sure Pokemon fans can tell the difference between.  Batteries are included which is always appreciated.

title: Straight Shooting!
text: My 22 year old son still likes Nerf guns. My husband is also just a kid at heart. They both have been having fun with this latest Nerf gun. My son likes that it's easy to shoot with one hand so technically he could have one in each hand and shoot without any difficulties. You can reach the hammer with the thumb of the hand holding it. Then according to my husband, it has a hair trigger so you barely have to touch the trigger and it shoots. It shoots pretty straight. My husband was in the kitchen. I was in the living room about 30 feet away and it just missed me. Both of my guys like this Nerf gun and have been having fun with it.

title: Fun for Minecraft Fans
text: This Minecraft figures set is fun for any Minecraft Fan. The figures feel sturdy enough for play. They do have moveable parts. For example, you can move their arms. Other than that they really don't do much. They would make a nice gift.

title: A Fancy Face Mask
text: My 19 year old daughter recently expressed interest in a sparkly face mask.  This black mask has a nice sparkle to it. The sparkle is created by the addition of some black sequins to a lightly sparkly fabric. It looks like sparkly threads are sewn into the fabric. The sequins seem to be securely attached, though time will tell. The mask is light weight, but there is a pocket for a filter if desired. It also has some stretch to it.  The ear straps are adjustable for fit and comfort. I think it looks better in person. It's a nice fancy face mask.

title: Lovely Puzzle Image
text: I've never been much of a puzzle person, but during the quarantine, I started doing them and decided that I enjoy them! This one has a lovely image. It's absolutely beautiful. The quality of the puzzle is good, too. The pieces are a decent size and thickness. I didn't notice any peeling corners or poorly cut pieces. Plus, this comes with a poster of the image to refer to when working which I really like. It's much easier to hold a poster than the whole box lid! Overall, I am very impressed with this puzzle.

title: Fun Assortment of Stickers!
text: This is a fun assortment of stickers. There are tons of sticker sheets each filled with a lot of cute stickers. There's a variety of sizes, shapes, and sticker subject. This would make a fun gift for a tween or young teen. The quality of the stickers is good. They adhere well and so far they've removed easily. My only issue is that the actual product box arrived crushed. It was shipped inside a box and that box was fine. I would have been disappointed if I was giving this as a gift.

title: Cuts Well
text: I haven't gotten a new pair of scissors in a long time. They don't seem super sharp, but they are adequately sharp enough. They feel a little stiff or tight, though they cut well. They're cute and look nice in my home office.

title: Vibrant Colors!
text: This is my second puzzle by this brand. The images are beautiful and vibrant. However, the puzzle pieces are really thin which made it difficult for the pieces to interlock and lay flat. There were a lot of pieces that were stuck together.  Many of the pictures were peeling away from the rest of the pieces. The puzzle wasn't too difficult to work and the finished project was nice.

title: Lovely Puzzle Image
text:
I have put together more puzzles in the last few months than I have in my entire fifty-two years. It's been the year of puzzles! This one is a vibrant colored one with a lovely image. I was really excited to assemble it. And it only has 500 pieces, which is definitely doable to do own my own. At least that was what I thought. Instead, I found it to be aggravating!!

Pros: Vibrant Colors; large pieces
Cons: No poster; thin pieces - several were pealing a bit; not enough variety in puzzle shapes - the interior pieces seemed to be all one shape. There were a couple of different (but always similar) border ones; the puzzle wouldn't lay flat.
Since the pieces were so similar, I can only assume that I had them correct, but it was definitely challenging and not a lot of fun. If you like the challenge, then I would recommend this. I am very good at seeing the different shapes and figuring out where they go on shape alone, and that technique didn't work for this one.

title: Wonderful Mario!
text: This plush Mario is awesome!! He's a little larger than I expected, but fortunately he's not one of those giant plushes you would get at the carnival! My 22 year old son has a few other Nintendo Mario themed plushes, but he did not have a Mario one. The plush is made well and has no noticeable flaws. My son is making room for him on his shelf with his other plushes.

title: Fun for Pusheen Fans!
text: I have always liked Pusheen, but I haven't owned any Pusheen items until now. She is cute.  She's a little larger than I expected. It's basically a giant squeezy stress ball. She supposedly is bread scented, but it smells more like caramel popcorn to me. Regardless, it smells good. I am keeping her on my desk.

title: Upgrade from Old Murder Mystery Sets!
text: Back in the early 2000's, we used to do Murder Mystery Parties with our group of friends. They were kits in boxes where everyone was assigned a character and we followed a loose script to solve the mystery. This is nothing like that. It's an upgraded version for sure. I would describe it as somewhat similar to an escape room experience, but instead of trying to escape, you are solving a murder. There are no characters to assign which is a relief! I hated trying to assign characters without offending people. And the characters were assigned genders so if you didn't have an even number of guys and girls, someone would have to play the opposite. It was never a big deal in my group of friends, but it could be for some.  Here you are the detective and team doing the solving. It comes with all kinds of fun evidence. There's a newspaper clipping that looks like a real newspaper clipping. There's a traffic ticket, photos, and so much more. I was very impressed with the level of creativity that went into it. The old style mystery boxes would have silly clues that didn't look real. This is so much cooler! If you use pencil or write out notes on your paper, you could easily pass this set onto someone else.

title: Sturdy
text: My 22 year old son plays D&D with his friends. He was happy to add these to his collection. They are plain, wooden pieces. It's easy to put them together and once assembled, they're pretty sturdy. My son is pretty artsy, so he plans to paint them.

title: Vibrant Colors!
text: This is a beautiful puzzle. It has vibrant colors. The pieces are a good thickness and overall quality. The pieces are marked on the backs so you can sort them faster. Most importantly, (in my opinion) it comes with a full size poster of the image! That is really helpful when assembling puzzles! Overall, this was a fun puzzle to work on.

title: Great Quality!
text: My 22 year old son is in college studying computers. He started out as a video game designer major, but changed it after a semester. But before he changed majors, he had to take a game design class that focused on how to make actual games. They had to make their own board game as a project. He really enjoyed that and has wanted to continue doing that on the side. He saw this game kit and was super psyched about it! He was taking out all the parts and pieces and I could see the gears turning! While he loved the game he made in class, it was too big and awkward in size. This has a folding game board, cards, dice, and pieces. He's already started a notebook to plan out his new game! This allows kids (and adults) to do something creative! We've talked about how he's going to do the game and he thinks he's going to print out color stickers for the board to make it look professional. He's also going to use fine tip permanent markers. For the cards, he's going to print out stickers for them, too. He is really excited about this!

title: Heavy Duty Nerf Gun!
text: This is a heavy duty Nerf gun! It's solid and has a good feel to it. It's easy to load. It has good accuracy, especially when compared to other Nerf guns. My 22 year old son is a fan of Nerf guns and finds this one to be quite nice. He often takes apart old ones and repaints them for Cosplay Accessories, though he said he won't do that to this one, at least not for a while. This does require a new, less common foam dart which is something to consider. Overall, it's a lot of fun!

title: Brings Back Memories
text: My parents had one of these in the house when I was a child. Sharing this with my own family brings back a lot of memories. This does require some assembly. I saved it for my husband to do. It didn't take him very long. The game isn't as sturdy as the one from my childhood. It doesn't feel cheap either, it's just not as solid as the one I grew up with. The drop spots are named after various planets. It doesn't include all of them as there is not enough spots for them, however I found it interesting that Pluto was included. My kids are 22 and 19 and both of them found it addictive trying to get to Pluto! It was fun watching them have some non-digital time!

title: D&D Fun!
text: My 22 year old son likes to play Dungeons and Dragons with his friends. He thinks these are pretty cool. They work well with the game play. The tokens are sturdy and easy to read. He and his friends like using these when they play.

title: Surprise!
text: Blind boxes are super popular these days. This one is for Barbie. We received the life guard and the film director accessories. The items are small and cute. The overall quality seems to be lower than previous Barbie accessories that we've gotten over the years. It is a fun way to introduce kids to different careers.

title: Great Math Manipulative!
text: My 6 year old niece has been having difficulties with math. She's currently doing online school at home. As a former elementary teacher, I have been helping her as much as I can. If she was in her real 1st grade classroom, she would have access to all kinds of learning materials, including math manipulatives. I started using this with her to give her additional support. In her learning space at home, there is a magnetic/chalkboard wall. These work very well on it. The pieces are a good size - the counters are about the size of a silver dollar. They're slightly larger than the face on my Galaxy Smartwatch. They are foam with magnetic backs. This is definitely easier than trying to track down small objects to use for her lessons. There is a storage bag to hold all the little pieces. It's been wonderful to see those moments when things are beginning to click with her!

title: Awesome Puzzle!
text: As many others during the pandemic, I've completed several puzzles. This one is awesome! First of all, the subject matter is very interesting. It's like a secret laboratory. It's been fun discovering all the hidden secrets in the room. Secondly, the quality of the puzzle is very good. The pieces are wooden, but light weight. The images are clear and colorful. The pieces come in a drawstring storage bag.  The pieces are coded on the back so you can sort them quickly. I like to sort my pieces first and that can take hours sometimes! And finally, it includes a full size poster of the puzzle image! That really helps me when I'm assembling puzzles. It's easier to hold a poster than a box lid. Plus, if you have helpers, you can both use something for reference.

title: Fun Activity
text: I used to make my own greeting cards with rubber stamps, so I was excited to share this craft with my 6 year old niece when she was visiting recently. This is a nice starter set for kids. The set includes pre-mounted wooden stamps, colored pencils, an 2 color ink pad and some outlined stickers of the same stamp images for coloring. The addition of the stickers was a little odd to me, because with the stamps and ink pad, you could basically make your own stickers. The stamps are a good quality. There is excess rubber around the images, so if you aren't careful when stamping, you may get the lines from the edges on your art work. I used to get stamps that had to be assembled, so I always trimmed the rubber around the edges to avoid that. The ink pad is a double one so you can carefully use just one side of the ink pad for a single color or put the rubber into the center and get both colors. There are no papers, cards, etc for stamping on to, so you need to get that. Otherwise, it's a fun activity for kids. My niece is 6 and she had a lot of fun with it.

title: Fun Outdoor Game!
text: We like to host outdoor cookouts. We will set up an assortment of "tailgate games". This is a new one that I have not seen before. It's kind of like corn-hole, but different. The game is pretty large and very sturdy. We did have difficulties putting it together. Some of the shelves were larger than the openings that they were to go in.  (Yes we were aware of that there were different sizes depending on where they were to go). My husband had to sand some of the pieces and that helped. He said if he had a router (which he didn't), that would of been perfect. He used a mallet and then some of the wood chipped. Once it was assembled, my husband told me that it's going stay that way. Game play is fun. It's an easy game to learn. It's been fun introducing a new game to our cookouts!

title: Hours of Fun!
text: I recently went to visit my sister and family during the pandemic. The 3 kids have been stuck at home for months, with online school and canceled summer camps. I decided to take this to share with them. Oh my goodness - this set of air dry clay provided hours of fun for everyone! Even the grown ups! My brother in law is a designer and is very artistic. He praised and praised this activity! First of all, this comes with 40 colors! We enjoyed the huge variety. The colors blend very well and allow you to create even more colors. The set comes with tools and accessories too. When you first open a packet and take the clay out, it has a slightly oily feel to it. After a minute or so of kneading it, the oiliness disappears. The clay is very soft and easy to mold. It doesn't smell like anything. It doesn't make a mess and leave crumbs like Play-Doh. Resealable baggies are included to store the unused/opened clay so it doesn't dry out. My sister liked it so much, she has decided that this is going to be the standard birthday gift this year for the kids' friends!

title: Great Math Manipulatives!
text: My 6 year old niece has been struggling with math. On-line learning during the pandemic has been challenging. As a former teacher, I have been trying to find ways to help her. If she was at school in-person, she would have access to base ten blocks in her classroom. At home, she is limited to 2-D illustrations. These base ten blocks are a lot different from the ones that I used to have in my classroom. They are a foam material with magnetic backs. These would be great to use on the white board!! The home classroom that my niece is using has a wall that's painted with magnetic chalk board paint, so these are perfect for her! The blocks do have to be separated which was very easy. My only negative about these, is that the 10 block rod does not exactly match a single row on the 100 block piece. It's not a problem when they're next to each other on the board, but if you wanted to stack them up on one another on a table, they don't match up exactly. These blocks are a great addition to any classroom, whether in a traditional school or at home.

title: Brings Back Memories!
text: When I was a teen, we played MASH, though we didn't call it that. I think we just called them fortunes.  Then when my daughter was in middle school, MASH was very popular and it was referred to as MASH. She had preprinted sheets that you fill out and an electronic version. She's now in college. She and her friends have had a blast with this updated version. The first time they played, the followed the rules. Since then, they've been playing the fortune part, but they have skipped some of the formal rules. It's still a lot of fun!

title: Engaging Game
text: My 6 year old niece has been struggling with her sight words. She's been doing online school since March. As a former teacher, I try to help her as much as I can. I thought an educational game would be fun. We had to punch out the cards which my niece enjoyed helping with. It was just the two of us, so once the game was ready to go, I would call out the words and then we both would search for it.  She had a lot of fun playing the game. We've only played with the lower levels of words so far, so it was more of review for her. But as the difficulty of words increases, it will be more effective as a learning tool. The game pieces are not very sturdy. If I was using this in a classroom, I would probably laminate them before letting the students use it. There is a bag to store the pieces in, although we did put the flies in a Ziploc baggie before putting it into the provided drawstring bag. Overall, I think it's a fun approach to sight words!

title: New Word Game
text: This new word game is a little confusing at first. It's also a little more complicated than some other, more well known word games. It requires at least 3 players. I played this with my niece (11), nephew (9) and my sister.  The absence of a timer wasn't a problem since the adults playing at easy access to their phones. The game play is okay. My sister and I love word games and we enjoyed it more than the younger players. We counted the game as Literacy time during the kids' current learning at home time.

title: Fun Game for Pixar Fans!
text: My family is a huge fan of all things Pixar. I thought it would be fun for a new version of an old classic game. For the most part, it's a regular Uno game. The cards have various characters from Pixar movies. There's some of the usual punishment cards, too. This game has a new one which has been a lot of fun! If you play the special Pixar card, then you have to select someone to name any Pixar movie. Then you have to name as many characters from that movie, up to 5 characters. Then for everyone you named correctly, the player whom you selected as to draw a card. So if you name 5, then he/she has to draw 5 cards. My family had fun trying to stump one another with the Pixar movies that don't have memorable character names. Overall, it's a fun game to play!

title: Fun Figure!
text: My 22 year old son still likes Pokemon stuff. He has a few shelves in his room devoted to his Pokemon collection. One shelf holds his Mega Construx Pokemon characters. He's got several different ones and was excited to add this one to his collection. He didn't run into any complications while building this. It did take a little while, but nothing out of the ordinary. Younger builders may require assistance. He is pleased with the finished Tyranitar.

title: Amusing!
text: My 19 year old daughter and her close group of friends love to play games. She has several other similar games. The type of game is pretty common -a card is put into play. Everyone chooses a response to the card. Funniest response wins. This one has the social media theme going one which is perfect for my daughter and her friends. There is a warning on it that the intended age group is 17 and up. It's not a large game, so my daughter took it with her to college.

title: Fun Puzzle for the Family
text: This is a fun puzzle for the family. The pieces are a good quality. There were no peeling or loose edges. It's colorful. A poster of the finished image is included which is a must have for me when I work puzzles! My only issue is that the pieces were not in a plastic bag. I've done a lot of puzzles this year and just about all (or perhaps all of them) are in a sealed baggy of some kind. These were not. The box is sealed well, but when I opened it, a few pieces fell onto the floor. We were able to locate them all and none were missing when we put the puzzle together, but that could have potentially been a problem.

title: Great Quality Wooden Puzzle
text: This puzzle has light weight wooden pieces. The image is strongly attached to the wood with no noticeable peeling. I am very impressed with the quality. I've worked a lot of puzzles this spring and this is one of the nicest. The pieces are marked on the back so you can sort them. It really does speed up the sorting process so you can start working on the actual puzzle. This comes with a large poster of the image. I love it when puzzles come with posters! It's easier to hold the poster to refer to than the box lid.

title: Challenging and at Times Frustrating
text: Like many others during the last few months, I have been doing quite a bit of puzzling. This puzzle is the first one where all the pieces are the same shape. That caused some frustrations on my part because I can often find the spot from identifying the shape without paying any attention to the picture. The quality of the puzzle is average. The thickness is fine. I didn't notice any peeling. The picture is vibrant, but not super crisp. It does not include a poster of the image, of which I am a big fan. Overall, it's okay.

title: Fun & Challenging!
text: This is a fun and challenging puzzle. The pieces are cut well and fairly sturdy. I did not come across any with peeling edges. It does not come with a poster of the image, so you're stuck having to hold the box lid in order to see where to place the pieces. The cork background is a little challenging, but not impossible. This would make a great gift for fans of the TV show.

title: Vibrant & Colorful
text: This is a vibrant and colorful puzzle. The pieces are of average quality and thickness. I didn't notice any pieces that were peeling. All of the pieces were cut well and I didn't have any of the problems that another reviewer had with one shape of pieces with a too thin/narrow part. It's pretty challenging as far as puzzles go, but with a little patience, it wasn't impossible to complete. It did not include a poster of the image which I really like. It makes it so much easier to work on ones that do come with a poster.

title: Good Puzzle
text: This is a good puzzle. The pieces are a little on the small side, but the thickness is adequate and I haven't noticed any images peeling off. The image is clear and vibrant. I can't help but think that the image is upside on the box lid. The photo was taken overhead, but the angle looks odd. Of course, that doesn't interfere with the puzzle at all because there are no words on it. I was disappointed that they don't include a poster of the image. I find those to be very helpful when I work on puzzles these days. Usually the posters are slightly larger than the box so it's easier for me to see the details.

title: Whimsical Puzzle!
text: The Gnome puzzle is whimsical and fun. It would make a perfect gift for anyone who loves gnomes. The quality of the puzzle pieces is very nice. They are a good thickness and the images were all secured well to the cardboard. It does not come with a poster. Posters make it easier to work when you are working with others. You don't have to fight over the box lid! Plus, with my eyesight these days, the posters are usually enlarged which is helpful. This didn't take too long to work though there are a lot of repeated colors/images.

title: Enjoyable
text: I found this to be an enjoyable activity, though there are a few flaws in my opinion. Most of the background scene pages were stuck together and it was tricky to separate them. They are fairly sturdy but some of the corners got bent in the process. The stickers are a nice quality. I found it a little difficult to remove them and very difficult to return them to their spots when finished. I may just remove all of the excess from each page of stickers to make it easier for putting them back. One of the pages looked used and had about 5 stickers placed in logical spots on the coordinated background. Had it been accidental, the stickers would have been upside and wouldn't stick, which is what makes me think it was intentional. I found the pages to be colorful and interesting. I did enjoy making my scenes. There are more options per background than you can use at one time, at least in my opinion. I was kind of the "less is more" crafter. I thought my 19 year old daughter would be interested in it, but she wasn't. She may change her mind if she sees me working on it.

title: Fun & Challenging
text: This is a fun and challenging puzzle. The image is pretty crisp. The colors are similar which makes it challenging, but it's doable. The quality of the pieces is good. They're pretty sturdy and I didn't notice any parts that were pulling up. There's no folded poster of the image which was disappointing. That's way easier than holding the box lid while you work. Overall, it's a good puzzle and would make a great gift for any Harry Potter fan!

title: Nice Puzzle Image
text: As with many other families, we've been puzzling a lot more lately, during this pandemic. This one is a little smaller than most of the ones we've been working on, but it does only 550 pieces. I think most of the ones we've done so far are 1000 piece ones. The quality is pretty good. I've had some thicker puzzles, but this isn't too thin that it's problematic. It has a nice puzzle image - it's perfect for Christmas in July! Or December. Really, the only complaint I have is that it doesn't come with a poster of it. I have found it is much easier to work from a poster that I can hold rather than the box lid. And when you have both, then it's great when you have multiple puzzlers working. Overall, it's a good puzzle.

title: Fun Puzzle to Complete
text: This was a fun puzzle to complete. It brought back lots of memories from an old favorite TV show. The quality of the pieces is good. I didn't come across any that had the image separating from the rest of it. The image quality was okay. It was clear enough to differentiate, but could have been crisper. I do wish it came with a poster of the image. In my old age, I'm finding it really helpful to have a poster to work with so I don't have to rely on the box lid as much.

title: Thoughtful
text: This game is less of a game and more of a "get to know someone" activity. The cards are color coded. You're supposed to start with one color and gradually advance to the next one and so on. There are questions, fill-in-the-blanks, and things to list or answer (not in a question form). There are no right or wrong answers. The further you advance, the more difficult the cards become. The subject matter becomes more challenging and it's more of a hot-seat type card. The set allows you to get to know a person's character rather than learning what someone's favorite hobby is. It's literally the size of a deck of cards. In fact, it is a deck of cards. It's very portable. There's nothing on the cards that is inappropriate. It's just a thoughtful and interesting activity.

title: Nice Puzzle Image
text: This outer space puzzle has a nice image which is pretty crisp and clear. The puzzle pieces are decent and not too thin. I didn't see any with the images coming up at the corners. The puzzle pieces are marked on the back to help speed up the sorting process. I'm noticing more and more puzzles having the markings on the back. It does help. The sorting part can take more time than the actual completing of the puzzle sometimes! This does come with a large poster of the image. The addition of the poster is something I really like. My eyesight has gotten horrible over the years and an enlarged poster really helps. Plus, the poster is easier to hold than the box lid! Overall, it's a good puzzle.

title: Beautiful Image
text: This is a nice puzzle with a beautiful image. The quality of the pieces are good. They are not too thin and I didn't have any ones that were coming up at the edges. It's a challenging puzzle, but not one of those impossible/frustrating ones. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is that it doesn't come with a fold out poster. I find it much easier to work with a poster of the image rather than the box lid. Plus, if multiple people are working on it at the same time, they both have something to look at while working on it.

title: Decent Puzzle Quality
text: I recently started working puzzles regularly. I had never really been a fan before, but with the pandemic, it was something different to do. This puzzle is a smaller one with only 500 pieces. The size of the pieces is a little on the small side, but it's not too bad. It does come with a large fold out poster which is a necessity for me when I'm puzzling. It's much easier to hold and look at a poster than have to hold onto the box lid. The pieces are marked on the back to speed up separating which was nice. That saved a lot of time. Overall, it's a decent puzzle.

title: Nice Puzzle Image
text: As with many others this spring, I've been doing lots of puzzles. This is a vibrant high quality puzzle. It's the first one that I've had lately that has had any kind of smell to it. Fortunately, that didn't last very long and it didn't completely surprise me. The puzzle pieces are cut well. They're a good thickness and connect well to one another. There was minimal puzzle dust, especially compared to some of the other puzzles that I have done recently. My biggest issue with this is that it doesn't come with a print out of the puzzle. I rely on those picture sheets of puzzle a lot when I am working on them. It's much easier to hold a sheet of paper than the whole box!

title: Excellent Flash Cards!
text: I recently sat down to read with my 6 year old niece. She struggled with a lot of common sight words. As a former elementary school teacher, I wanted to help her. These are excellent flash cards! There are 6 boxes of cards, one for each level PreK through 3rd grade. Then the 6th box is full of blank ones that are reusable (dry erase marker). All of the cards are sturdy and easy to read. Each card is double sided to accommodate more words!  I used to make flash cards like these for my kids when they were younger. They're both in college now, and don't need my help with flash cards. The cards come with 6 rings so you can remove and rearrange the cards as needed. That makes it easy to keep the ones that your child is still struggling with together for quick access. I highly recommend these!

title: Great Quality!
text: We've had a lot of free time at home during this shelter in place which has led to a lot of family puzzle time! This one is a great quality! I was impressed with the wooden pieces. I don't think I've ever done a puzzle of this size that had wooden pieces. Of course, the kids had wooden puzzles but those were fewer pieced, children's puzzles. The images are colorful and bright. It comes with a poster of the image as well as a storage bag for the pieces. It's also the first time I've ever had a puzzle with letter codes on the back. We really tried to not use that and only looked at them when we couldn't figure out pieces. Overall, it's a nice puzzle.

title: Fun!
text: My eighteen year old daughter and her friends are slightly obsessed with the blind bag type toys. This is a 3 pack, so she shared this with 2 of her friends. You throw the ball on the ground or a different hard surface and it breaks apart. Inside is a small plush item with a clip attached. Our set had a mermaid, a narwhal and a butterfly. The pieces fit back together like a puzzle. I personally couldn't put it back together, but my daughter did without any difficulties. I probably could have figured it out if I had enough time. I do like that there's a purpose to the puzzle ball and it's not just trash. Overall, it's fun!

title: Cute Figurines!
text: Wall-E has been a favorite Disney movie of my family's since it came out. My 18 year old daughter absolutely loves it! It's been several years since the movie was released, so it was a happy surprise to find these figurines. While I called them figurines, they could be more of an action figure. They have parts that move, but they don't really do much. My daughter has these sitting on her book shelf in her bedroom. They're made pretty well. They don't give us the impression that they will break easily. They're really cute!

title: Wonderful Idea!
text: I think that puzzles geared specifically for those suffering from Dementia or Alzheimers is a wonderful idea! The quality of this puzzle is outstanding. The pieces are a good size so they are easy to grip and hold. They are made from a sturdy plastic and won't bend or break. The box doubles as a tray to work the puzzle in and has a magnetic closure. There are questions on the inside of the box to encourage dialogue. Overall, I am very impressed with this puzzle. It could also be used for children.

title: Great Images!
text: This puzzle has some great images! My husband and I enjoyed all the retro movie posters represented. There are several that we have actually seen! The pieces are good and comparable to a lot of other puzzles that we've worked on. It comes with a color mini poster which helps with assembly. Lots of fun!

title: Wonderful Puzzle!
text: This is a wonderful puzzle! My family had so much fun with it. The pieces are good quality. The puzzle comes with a mini-poster of the image which makes it easier to work with than the box to see what you're working on. The image is full of small, Sci-Fi book covers which we found entertaining.

title: Pretty Scene
text: This puzzle has a pretty scene. It's colorful and vibrant. The pieces are sturdy cardboard. Most of the pieces were fully intact, but there were a couple where the edges were coming up just a tiny bit. There's a nice variety of puzzle shapes. Most of the pieces are standard puzzle sized, but there are a few that are a little on the small side. The pieces interlocked well. My biggest complaint is that it doesn't come with a print out of the puzzle. My close up vision has gotten pretty bad over the years, so I have to have the picture on hand. It's not convenient having to hold the entire puzzle box lid. It's not impossible, just not desired.

title: Great Puzzle!
