text: I have a few other puzzles by this brand and I really like them. This is my favorite. It only has 500 pieces whereas my other ones had more. I think realistically, I need to stick with smaller pieces or it takes forever for me to finish! Part of the issue is my vision. I have to wear glasses for reading and up close vision. The image of this is not too crowded therefore, it is easier for me to see. I had a 1000 piece one of the world by the same company and there was so much detail crammed into it, that it was really difficult for me to see it adequately for me to work it. The actual pieces of this are smallish, but the details are not crammed. I like that these puzzles come with posters  which are easier to deal with than the box lid when assembling puzzles. They also include a plastic zipper baggy to keep the pieces in when you're done. The boxes are really good, too, and are designed well so you don't accidently spill the contents! This is a bright and colorful puzzle. The pieces are good quality. They're small, with a few weirdly shaped ones, but overall, they are fine. I'm going to check into other puzzles by this brand!

title: Fun Assortment!
text: This type of stickers is very popular right now. My college aged kids and my nieces and nephews look picking through them. They cover their notebooks with them. The quality is decent and is comparable to other vinyl stickers. The images are colorful and printed well. This is a fun assortment!

title: Nice Quality Puzzle
text: I just finished watching my nieces and nephew for the week. My nephew (9 years old) is really good at puzzles. He can solve a Rubix Cube in just a short amount of time. I thought he might get a kick out of this puzzle. It's a nice quality puzzle. The pieces are sturdy and smooth (no splinters!). I gave it a try and couldn't figure it out. My nieces (11 & 6) couldn't do it either. However,  sometime over the course of a couple of days, the puzzle ended up on the kitchen counter back to it's original cube shape. It's a fun, challenging activity to keep you busy!

title: Gorgeous Picture!
text: This puzzle has a gorgeous picture of Sydney, Australia. The pieces are colorful and vibrant. The poster image is large enough to see adequately. The shape of the puzzles pieces are less traditional compared to other puzzles. There are some really strange and different shapes, along with the standard puzzle shapes. There were several that seemed to have a flat edge and could possibly be a border piece, but they weren't. I like that this brand provides a zipper storage baggie to keep the pieces in when you're done.

title: Vibrant and Colorful
text: I haven't always been a fan of puzzles, but lately I've been slightly obsessed. This one is vibrant and colorful. The pieces are just a tad larger than the ones that I've been working with lately, but not at all as large as ones geared toward children. The pieces are a good thickness and most of them have been an excellent quality. I came across about two that were less than perfect. One had a slightly bent piece and another had the image peeling off its corner. It comes with a zipper style baggie to store the pieces in when you're done, which I love! I am always doing that anyway. It also has a mini poster of the finished poster image. The poster is larger than the box cover, therefore making it easier to use than holding the box, but it is still small. My reading vision has gotten very poor over the last few years and even with my reading glasses on, I had a lot of difficulty deciphering a lot of the details on the poster. The details on the actual puzzle pieces wasn't as challenging. I would definitely consider ordering more puzzles by this company.

title: Simple and Basic Game
text: My husband and I recently played this with our nieces and nephew (ages 5, 9, and 11). The 5 year old needing some assistance with the reading, but the others did fine. It's a nice, clean game and appropriate for everyone. It's pretty basic and easy to play, but it's also interesting and fun. It's very portable too!

title: I Enjoyed This Puzzle!
text: I enjoyed this puzzle of an Italian scene. I usually go for 1000 piece puzzles, but I found this smaller one quite refreshing. My husband and I were able to complete it in just a weekend, working on it here and there. The pieces were sturdy enough and I didn't see any peeling or bending of them. The colors are nice and vibrant. I will definitely check out other puzzles by this company.

title: Genius!
text: I think this product is absolutely genius! It's made puzzle time at my house a lot more doable. Over the holidays, when the kids were home from college, we started a puzzle on the kitchen table. A couple of days before Christmas, the puzzle still wasn't finished, but since we had guests arriving for the holidays, we had to put the puzzle away. I've tried the rolling mats before, and they do an okay job, but this is just perfect! So now we can just pick up the puzzle tray and relocate it until we can work on it again. There are four drawers to hold the unused pieces. The board is an unfinished pine. It's not fancy at all, but it does the job. And a very good job it does! It comes with a felt mat and an inflatable roll so you can roll it up if you want. This allows us to work on puzzles at  times when we normally wouldn't because we needed the table space.

title: Convenient!
text: I am so excited about this party in a box kit! My daughter is away at college. I plan to send this kit with one of her close friends so they can throw her a surprise birthday party. The kit comes with balloons and curling ribbon, a cute garland, and plenty of paper goods. I'll throw in some money so they can get some food, too. Did I mention that she loves dinosaurs? She's going to love this! The quality is comparable to what you would find at the local party store. The colors are bright and cheerful. It's definitely convenient to have everything together.

title: Such Fun!
text: This is a really fun game! Although my family members are all adults now, it's more fun playing this version than the original one. My kids get embarrassed easily when playing adult version games with their parents! Plus, when they're much younger cousins are visiting, we can all play this together. It's been a hit!

title: Set of 4 Football Themed Table Cloths
text: These table cloths arrived just in time for our Super Bowl party. It is a set of 4 disposable table cloths. I suppose you could reuse them - I know my grandmother used to do that, but they are intended for single use. We used one for our party and the rest are being saved for fall tailgating.

title: Interesting!
text: This is an interesting game that works best for larger groups. You also need a plenty of space for the game play. Rather than guessing the actions of the players, you are trying to figure out the intensity levels of the performers. I found it helpful to watch the video that was on the game description before playing. There are 10 different intensity levels. I think it would be easier to play (especially with kids) if there were fewer levels. It can be difficult to determine the difference between an intensity level 5 and an intensity level 6. I guess that's a way to keep the tokens from being handed out too quickly. You don't take turns like many games, so it's engaging for all the players which is good when you have children playing. Overall, it's a fun, new game.

title: Lots of Fun!
text: In this age of technology, I found this to be a fresh and timely game. You're given an incomplete statement that is part of an actual online search. You have to complete it, then the players guess as to which one is the real search. It's lots of fun and easy to play. We played this as a family (with our college age kids) and then my daughter has played it with her friends away at school. Everyone has agreed that it's clever and fun. It isn't very big, so it's easy to take with you if desired.

title: Fun Intro to Circuits!
text: My 9 year old nephew recently spent the weekend with us. He had been wanting to do "nerdy tech" stuff with my husband and 22 year old son according to my sister. This was one of the activities they did together. The kit comes with everything needed to do the activities. The directions were easy to follow and understand. The activities were engaging and a fun introduction to the world of circuits. All three of them enjoyed playing around with this kit!

title: Can Be Fun in the Right Group
text: This is one of those games that could be a lot of fun with the right group. I think it would best for non-couples as some of the questions asked, I wouldn't want to know my husband's answer. The content is very adult and lots of questions are sex related. It might be fun for a girls weekend or bachelorette party.  It's a compact size and it seems like it's more of an expansion pack rather than a stand alone game. The rules are simple enough to follow.

title: Cute Plush!
text: The unboxing of this surprise mystery item was not as exciting as other ones, but the plush is cute and a nice quality. We got the sloth which is rather plain compared to other animals, but it's cute. We liked the sleeping bag feature.

title: Fun!
text: My 18 year old daughter has gotten caught up in the surprise box toys. She and one of her college friends enjoy collecting them. I know that they're not the target audience, but I let her have it. The two girls were over for the weekend. They thought the presentation was good. The pet carrier was cute and a decent quality. They weren't sure what to do with the pacifier and ended up ripping it off the string that attached to the animal. They received a blue/pink walrus. The animal is matted in some kind of glue or gel like substance. The girls took turns combing it. A lot of fuzz and dust came off as they combed it. When they were done, the walrus was sort of cute, but overall, they felt it wasn't really a quality stuffed toy. The whole experience was fun, but the end results were just okay.

title: Bright and Colorful!
text: This Trolls World Tour Lego set is bright and colorful. It's an easy to build set. The recommended ages is appropriate. It comes with 1 mini fig, which as far as I can tell, is not a primary character in the movie. There is also a sea creature. This would be fun for fans of the Trolls movies.

title: Lego Fun!
text: My first thought when I saw this Lego set was that it wasn't that impressive. But when I started comparing it to MineCraft stuff, I realized it's a darn close interpretation. It's easy to put together and it the finished products look like the real thing. The recommended age is appropriate. It's a small set and didn't take long to assemble. My only complaint is that this was sent in a padded envelope and the box was crushed upon arrival.

title: Entertaining!
text: My husband has a high end drone which our 9 year old nephew has coveted. My husband wanted something geared more toward beginners so he could introduce drones to him. This one is a decent beginner model. The directions were easy enough for my husband to follow. The actual unit works pretty well. The camera quality is just okay. Our nephew couldn't really tell the difference between this one and my husband's more expensive one, so that was a success. The two of them enjoyed torturing the cats in the house with it!

title: So Much Fun!
text: My nieces and nephew were visiting this past weekend. I thought this would be a fun activity for them. They had a blast!! I tried downloading the app, but wasn't having much luck with that. I had intended to have my husband help me, but time got away from me. But that didn't matter, the kids had so much fun using it anyway.  They loved having their voices amplified. The oldest, who is eleven, had a lot of fun with the different voice changers. The youngest, who is 6, just enjoyed singing into it and having her voice amplified. They played with it for hours!

title: Fun!
text: My 22 year old son is a life long Pokemon fan. He still collects cards, though he's parted with hundreds of non-special ones over the last few years. He has several plush Pokemon and figurines on display in his room. He's put together several other Pokemon Mega Blocks, too. This is the latest to go into his collection. He enjoyed putting it together, but he said for a much younger builder, some assistance may be required since there are lots of small pieces. It didn't take him too long to build it. He says it's a great addition to his collection.

title: Great Images!
text: I ordered these as a fun activity for my 18 year old daughter to do with her younger cousins. It's a great assortment of images, all pertaining to Day of the Dead. They're small and about the size of a sheet of paper. They're thinner than I expected. I wouldn't call them posters at all because of the thinness. They're not much heavier than regular paper. The finished products look nice. Overall, we liked them.

title: Pokemon Fun!
text: This Mega Blok Pokemon set is perfect for any Pokemon fan! Not only are there two characters to build, but some buildings, too. The suggested age is 6 and up. I would concur with that, though younger builders may need a little assistance. The instructions were easy to follow. The finished products are cute and fairly sturdy. Great Pokemon Fun!

title: Fun!
text: This is a fun set of 34 stickers. While these aren't girly stickers, they do seem to have more appeal to girls than boys. The images are vibrant and clear. The vinyl material is sturdy. These are great for covering notebooks and folders.

title: Cute!
text: My 22 year old son is STILL a big fan of Pokemon. He has shelves in his room full of Pokemon things. This little guy has a spot on one of those shelves. It was easy to put together and didn't take my son very long to build it. Instructions were easy to follow. He thinks that the suggested age level is accurate.

title: Fun!
text: Stickers like this have become very popular! Even my college aged kids like them. This set is full of girl (but not necessarily girly) themed stickers. The vinyl surface is sturdier than paper stickers. They have a good adhesiveness. Overall, these are fun!

title: So Cute!
text: This Lego set is so cute! It's one of the smaller sets geared toward 6 and up. I think that small sets like this are great for kids because it's not overwhelming. They can successfully build it on their own and have a sense of completion. A lot of the larger sets can lead to moments of frustration or the need for assistance. This Moana set has one minifig and an animal, too. It's a great set for any Moana fan!

title: Cute Assortment
text: Stickers have been really popular with my own kids (18 and 21) as well as my nieces (6 & 11) and nephew (9). I let my own kids pick through them first, then they share with their cousins. These are mostly winter themed stickers. They are smaller than some others that I have ordered, but they're cute nonetheless. The images are vibrant and colorful.

title: Perfect for D&D
text: This is an item that my son didn't know he needed. Now that he has it, he wishes he had found it sooner. My son is 21 and plays Dungeons and Dragons with his friends. He has a bunch of dice, but just keeps them in a small box. He LOVES this new dice case. It's very sturdy and works great! He can store all of his dice in it easily. The zipper is very heavy duty and glides well. There's a clip on the case so he can hang it on his backpack when he goes to game nights. His only comment was that the company missed out on an opportunity by not including one unique die with their logo imprinted on it!

title: Fun Surprise!
text: The Rainbocorns are one of the many surprise/blind items geared toward kids. This one has a good sized stuffed animal, but there are also many other surprises included, too. The quality of the pink lion that we had in our egg, was surprisingly nice. The items are probably best geared toward 6-10 year olds, but I'm sure some kids outside of that range would enjoy it too.

title: Fun Surprise!
text: My 18 year old daughter just completed her first semester away at college. One thing she brought back with her was a love for those new surprise/blind collectibles. Evidently she and her friends go to Wal-Mart and buy the little surprise balls. I thought she might enjoy a bigger one. The items are geared toward a younger market, so I thought this would be something she could experience and share with her 6 year old cousin. The girls had a lot of fun opening this surprise. I like that you know what the big item is before hand. That could be really expensive if you were trying to get a specific animal. Of course, you don't know if you're getting the regular one or the golden one, so there is that element of surprise. The rest of the items are more surprising. The quality of the stuffed animal is nice, but the other items are more party store quality. The experience and fun that the egg unveiling is priceless!

title: Set of 4 Activity Books
text: This Highlights set is a set of 4 holiday (Christmas, Easter, Halloween, and Valentine's day)  themed activity books. I would estimate the target audience to be pre-k through 1st grade. The books are colorful and have a mix of drawings and photos. The books are filled with mazes, crafts, recipes and more. I was a little disappointed that they do not have any of the classic hidden picture pages, but they still do contain a lot of activities.

title: Nice Assortment
text: My 21 year old son is a card collector - primarily Pokemon and Magic the Gathering. He has several boxes like this for keeping smaller quantities of cards as well as larger organizational storage. These are sturdy little boxes. They're different colors which make it easier to keep them sorted. There are dividers inside the boxes in case you want to separate them somehow. They don't hold a whole lot of cards, but they good.

title: Huge Playset!
text: This is a huge playset and takes up a lot of room. Assembly is required. There are lots of little stickers to apply which may require adult help. The finished set reminded me of Disney's Frozen. It's pretty sturdy and should hold up to hours of playtime.

title: Cute Dino Clip
text: My 18 year old daughter loves dinosaurs. She didn't develop this love for them until high school. I thought this would be something cute that she could wear on her bookbag. It has a fruity scent to it. It's supposed to be blue raspberry, but I really couldn't tell for sure if that's what it smells like. It's definitely fruity. This would make a great stocking stuffer!

title: Outdoor Fun!
text: We are a fan of the large, over sized games such as this one for outdoor parties. Friends of ours had a similar one that they took with them tailgating. These blocks are sturdy and strong. It comes with a wipe board so you can keep score and make up your own rules.  The storage bag is just okay. It's a bit thin and doesn't seem like it's going to last long. My husband has already transferred them to a plastic tub for storage. The game is a lot of fun. It needs a solid surface to play on. We've been using a wooden picnic table in our yard.

title: Great Introduction to Coding
text: My 9 year old nephew has been wanting to learn geeky nerd stuff. His father is anything but a nerd and so my sister wanted my husband to step in and share some geeky stuff with her son. My husband is a programmer and a Star Wars fan, so this activity kit was just up his alley. First of all, the kit comes with batteries! I love it when the batteries are provided! My nephew was a great age for this. The suggested age for this is pretty wide and may not engage much younger or older kids as much as it did our nephew. They used this on a PC. The coding was easy enough and our nephew was able to do it with guidance from my husband. From start to finish, including plenty of play time, they spent a couple of hours on this. My husband thought it was definitely a worthwhile activity for kids. My nephew is not interested in trying other coding activities now.

title: Cute Jewelry Box!
text: My family has enjoyed Lego play sets for years, but this is the first one that I can remember that is more than just a play set. The finished project is a functioning jewelry box. The kit is fairly easy to put together, with some parental assistance helpful for younger builders. The directions are easy to follow. There are a few stickers to put on specific pieces which most sets do not have. The finished jewelry box is pretty cool looking and a lot of fun for the recipient.

title: Lego Fun for Frozen Fans
text: There's something about treehouses that are super fun! This one is no exception. The directions are clear and easy to follow. The recommended age level is appropriate. The finished treehouse is cute and a lot of fun to play with. It comes with 3 minifigs. Another great Lego set!

title: Fun!
text: I've been buying the special Lego mini figs for my kids for years! They're now 21 and 18 and still enjoy them. My 21 year old opened this one. It was the Galactic Bounty Hunter. He has amassed quite the collection of mini figs over the years. He has them displayed on a shelf in his room. He was impressed with the assortment of characters in this set. He commented that this was one of the best assortments that he has seen over the years. He is really hoping to get the pizza guy one of these days. These make great stocking stuffers!

title: Fun Game!
text: I am unfamiliar with the Unstable Unicorn game, but we have played the Exploding Kittens one. Without a lot of prior knowledge, we found this game a little difficult to understand at first, but we managed to catch on after a while. We played it with 4 people, ages 51, 53, 18, and 21. The game involves a lot of puns and strategy. The illustrations on the cards were amusing. The box doesn't take up a lot of space, so it is easy to travel. It's not a quick game, but can be played in less than a hour.

title: Good Quality Toy!
text: The Melissa and Doug magnetic play sets are good quality toys. When compared to some of the other Melissa and Doug magnetic sets, this one falls short. This safari rescue set is a cute idea, but it really could use some more magnetic animals and accessories. The magnets work well. And you could potentially use them with other sets. The pieces stay in place well.  It's cute, but not a lot there to keep one's interest in it for long.

title: A New Take on Paper Dolls
text: This magnetic play set is like a new take on paper dolls. Everything stays in place way much better than they did with paper dolls. These don't have all the clothing that paper dolls had, but there are accessories. There are a few people and they have stands to keep them upright. There's a scene set of the castle. Everything is pretty sturdy and well made. Everything stores nicely in the box and would be great for traveling.

title: Fun Play Set!
text: This magnetic play set by Melissa & Doug is great! Not only is it sturdy and well made, but there are lots of pieces and accessories so it provides kids with lots of possible scenarios to play with. The magnetic pieces stick well and don't fall off easily. This pet center is really a fun play set!

title: Great for Creative Play!
text: My nieces (5 & 10)  and nephew (8) spend a lot of time at our house. I like to have unique toys that they don't have at home to keep them entertained. This magnetic play set by Melissa & Doug has been perfect! It easily accommodates all of their ages. This set comes with a pirate ship, building, characters and lots of magnetic props. It's a modern twist to the old school paper dolls that I grew up with. The subject appeals to both boys and girls. The play set is sturdy and should last. I am very impressed with it!

title: Great for Multiple Builders!
text: This Lego set is great for multiple builders! My nieces (5 & 10) and nephew (8) were visiting this past weekend. I cleared off the kitchen table and put this set in front of them. My own 2 children (18 & 21) worked with them. Because there are so many smaller items to build, they divided up the building. This allowed everyone to work at the same time without getting in the way of another. It also kept them all entertained for a while!!! The details are amazing with this set. My personal favorite is the coffee cart. I loved watching all of them work together to create an adorable play set!

title: Amazing Lego Set!
text: This is an amazing Lego set!! I'm not sure who had more fun with this, my husband or my 21 year old son. The details are incredible. It took the two of them a couple of hours to build it. It also led to a lot of Batman discussions between them. The set comes with 7 mini figs plus Clayface. This set might be a little challenging for younger builders, so help may be required. The directions were easy to follow.

title: Fun Lego Set!
text: This is a fun Lego set! My 21 year old son and his 8 year old cousin had a good time playing with it. The 8 year old did most of the building while my son downloaded the app. While they did get the app to work, they preferred playing without it. There are so many fun little details in this set, that their creative juices were put to good use.

title: Amazing Lego Set!
text: This is an amazing Lego set! First of all, it comes with 14 mini figs! And they're not just run of the mill people. You've got a bunch of really interesting people, from the family going to the fair and all the carnival workers. They're all different and well suited to the set. It really does look like a carnival midway with all the games! The set is pretty easy to build and even more fun to play with!

title: Great Fun for Harry Potter Fans!
text: This Lego set is of a more minor scene from the Harry Potter, Goblet of Fire. It comes with 4 mini figs, one of which is Hagrid. The carriage is really cool. It opens up to reveal a 2 story play set. The carriage is a little more difficult to put together with all of the intricate details. It might be a challenge for younger builders. My 18 year old daughter did okay with it. The finished product is awesome! This is great fun for Harry Potter Fans!

title: So Much Fun!
text: I love the Lego Friends line! While they seem to be targeted at girls, there are a lot of sets that aren't girly girl such as this one. The mini figs are both girls, but you could easily substitute other mini figs to play with. Marine biology is a popular career interest for kids these days, so this allows them to explore that option a bit. It also allows for lots of creative play. This set is interesting as well as fun. It didn't take too long for my 18 year old daughter and her younger (8 & 10) cousins to build. They split up the jobs. They found this set a lot of fun to play with after it was completed.

title: Fun!
text: This Disney Color game is a lot of fun! We recently played it with my sister and her family. My kids (21 & 18) and hers (5,9, 11). The game play is for 2 to 4 individuals or teams. We played in team mode. The cards are a medium thickness. The score sheet involves coloring (no crayons or pencils provided) so that continues the whole color theme. The game plays fast and everyone enjoyed it. It seemed like it was going to be pretty easy, but it's a lot harder than we expected! You think you remember the colors of these Disney characters, but a lot of the times, we were wrong!

title: Awesome Lego Set!
text: My own kids love Legos! While they are getting older (21 & 18), I have found that Legos are a great to build with their younger cousins (9 & 11). It's a great bridging activity between the age groups. The younger kids visit regularly and enjoy building Lego sets with my kids. I've found that the cooperative atmosphere works better with only 2 kids, so this one was enjoyed by my 21 year old son and his 9 year old cousin. It pretty much took the two of them all day to build this from start to finish. There is a lot to build, so they mostly "divided and conquered". Both builders found the process fairly straight forward. The younger one did need some help a couple of times, but for the most part it was easy to put together. Once they finished building it, they had fun playing with it. They tried to transfer the finished set to my son's bedroom so he could display it, but that was a fail. So they disassembled it and put it in baggies so they could put it together again one day.

title: Cute!
text: I really didn't know what to expect from these. I was thinking they were like stress balls and they kind of are, but they are also filled with a liquid. When you squeeze them, they get stretched out very thin and you think they might pop, but they don't. These are fun to just hold on to. They have the same kind of appeal that fidget toys have. I used to be a teacher and would keep toys like this in the classroom for students to use when needed. The Harry Potter ones are really cute!

title: Entertaining!
text: We recently played this game while on a family vacation. We had 4 adults and 2 teens, and 2 tweens. We were impressed with the pieces that game with the game. Unfortunately it's pretty much a one time use game. The pacing of the game was fair. We were able to solve the game before the time ran out. The only ones in our group who had ever done an escape experience were the teenagers. They weren't that impressed with the game. The tweens were the ones who enjoyed it the most. The wording of some of the clues was strange. I think the company was trying to be clever with it, but it fell short. Overall, we did have fun and it kept everyone off their phones for a while.

title: Fun Surprise!
text: Who doesn't love the element of surprise? I think this is a fun idea. You don't know what career path your Barbie has taken until you open the little boxes. There are 2 different careers in each doll set so you can still have a little bit of choice in the process. My Barbie's career options were Vet and Artist, both vastly different. The doll itself is pretty basic. The doll comes with job appropriate clothing and accessories.

title: Great for Party Decorating!!
text: This is great for party decorating! It's an excellent alternative to using helium. Since Helium is a natural gas and currently there is a shortage of it, the price of helium balloons has gone up considerably. This kit allows you to put together your own balloon clusters that look professional and beautiful! It is easy to use. You just snap the pieces together. You can stagger the heights. We've only used them inside, but they look wonderful! And without using helium, suddenly the cost of balloon decorating goes down quite a bit!  You can reuse the pieces for the next occasion! I love this!

title: Great Lego Set!
text: My daughter is 8 years older than her oldest cousin on my side of the family.  We spend a lot of time together, so recently I discovered that the building Lego sets together is something they both like and can do together when the cousins visit. My daughter would have loved this set when she was younger. She had several of the Lego Friends sets and loved horses. Her 10 year old cousin is into the horse stage now, so this set was a big hit for the two girls this past weekend. The set was age appropriate for the 10 year old. It took the two girls an hour or so to complete it. Once it was set up, they spent some time playing with it. My daughter even brought out some of her old Legos to create an even larger play set. The girls spent a good part of the afternoon playing together until my daughter felt that she had to go get on her phone! This is  great set for horse lovers!

title: Cute!
text: I ordered the little Aliens to put on my nephew's birthday cake. They're pretty basic as far as figures go. The arms can move a little bit, but that's about all. However, they're really cute! And as decorations on the cake, they were perfect! They're larger than usual cake decorations which made it fun! The kids had fun playing with them after the cake time.

title: Adorable!
text: This Mario Mushroom is adorable! It's pretty big and super soft! It's also very squishable. This is great for any Mario fan. My 21 year old son has a few other stuffed Mario characters, so he happily took this to add to his collection. Right now it's actually on his bed. It's been a long time since he's had any stuffed animals on his bed! The is a nice quality and much better than the kind you would get at an amusement park or carnival.

title: Yabba Dabba Doo!
text: I am was born in the late 60's so while I wasn't around when it first aired on TV, I grew up watching The Flintstones. It's definitely a favorite from my childhood. This is probably the most excited I've ever been for a Lego set. The nostalgic feelings that I had for this when I first saw it were practically overwhelming. The Lego Company has done a great job of turning Fred and Wilma and their home into Lego building blocks. The set includes mini figs of Fred, Wilma, Barney, and Betty. Of course, I would love to have seen a Dino mini fig or Pebbles and Bam Bam, but it's atypical of Lego to include all the characters. The set was pretty easy to build. My 18 year old daughter helped me and we finished in less than an hour. Now I wonder if we could get a Gilligan's Island set next?

title: Fun!
text: My 21 year old son loves Pokemon. He has been a fan for most of his life. He likes building the Pokemon block sets and displaying the finished creations on shelves in his bedroom. He found this set to be fairly easy to assemble, though someone young and inexperienced with these kinds of blocks might need some assistance. The finished product looks great!

title: Pool Fun!
text: Right out of the package, my 5 year old niece took the head of the squid off of the base. She was just playing around with it and not doing anything that I would consider rough housing. You can't put it back unless you unscrew the battery area and take it completely apart. Once it was put back together, the kids (5, 8, 10, and 18) had fun trying to beat their times. They used a white board near the pool and made a chart with their times so everyone could see what they had to make to beat their time. They played with it for quite a while before they grew bored with it.

title: Only 2 of the Balloons Worked!
text: My daughter graduated from high school last week. I ordered this set so we could put some balloons out at the mailbox on graduation day. Of the 5 balloons in the set, only 3 of the balloons actually inflated - the large one and the 2 round ones. The other two did not have any opening to insert the helium. There was a place marked, but there was no actual opening. I cut a hole into it and inflated it, but the balloon kept sinking after that. The large balloon inflated all right, but it would not stand up straight. It kept flipping upside down. My husband had to weight it down to get it to stay upright. The other 2 round ones worked perfectly as expected. I know I didn't pay a lot for these balloons, but this was a huge disappointment.

title: So Much Fun!
text: My 5 year old niece and 8 year old nephew were visiting this past weekend. My husband and I had so much fun putting this together with them. We're huge Pixar fans and I will admit that we will stop on any Pixar movie when we're scrolling through the TV channels. The set was age appropriate for the kids. The recommended ages are 4 and up. The set is a carnival scene from the upcoming Toy Story 4 movie. It comes with 3 mini figs (Buzz, Woody, & Bo Peep) as well as 2 smaller mini figs of new characters (Ducky & Bunny). This was a fun activity for us to do together.

title: Toy Story 4 Figures
text: These figures are from the new Toy Story movie coming out next month. It comes with Woody and Forky. They're on the small side and they don't really do anything. Woody can hold the lasso, but that's all. Nonetheless, they will hopefully spark some creative play.

title: Fun!
text: This is a fun game. It requires a minimum of 3 players, and can accommodate up to 10 players. The instructions made sense and were easy to follow. It didn't take very long for us to start playing either. It's recommended for ages 14 and up, but I think a little younger would be okay.

title: Another Great Lego Set!
text: This is another great Lego set and is perfect for any young Toy Story fan. This is a simpler Lego set and geared toward younger builders. The instructions are easy to follow. It didn't take very long for my 5 year old niece and 17 year old daughter to build.

title: Fun Toy!
text: This is a fun toy and great for Toy Story fans. Buzz is a good size - not too big and not too small.  He "walks" around, but really it's more of "he takes a step here and there". He spouts out several different familiar Buzz phrases. He shoots laser beams. His wings pop open. He's a great little action figure!

title: Compact!
text: This is a compact version of Scrabble. The pieces are small and a little hard to read. The tiles snap into place on the board which is nice because you don't have to keep pushing them around so they line up perfectly as I tend to do. The tile trays that each person uses to keep their tiles in during the game play has a cover so they can be hidden or so they don't fall out when transporting mid-game. Everything fits in the zippered case. I found it a little difficult to play with because of the size. At my age, I can't see anything without my readers on, so I prefer the original game. However, this does travel well.

title: Fun Lego Set!
text: This new Toy Story Lego set is geared toward younger Lego fans. It comes with 3 mini figs - Buzz, Bo Peep, and Bonnie. The set is easy to build and comes with easy to follow instructions. The finished set is a cute playground scene from the new Toy Story movie. This will be fun for any young Toy Story fan.

title: Fun for Pokemon Fans!
text: My now 21 year old son has pretty much been a lifelong Pokemon fan. Maybe not his entire life, but at least most of it.  He's looking forward to the new movie coming out. When he saw this set, he actually showed some excitement over it! He admitted that although he loves Pikachu, he was more excited about Ludicolo! The instructions were okay, but not great. At his age, he didn't have much trouble putting it together. A younger fan might need some help. It seems like Mega Construx instructions fall a little short when compared to Lego. For the most part, the finished product is pretty sturdy. My son has it on display on a shelf in his room and so far it has been fine. He is really happy with it.

title: Challenging!
text: My 8 year old nephew mastered the original Rubik's Cube very quickly. We thought it would be fun to make it more challenging on his next visit. He was here last weekend and loved the new challenge! He wore a blindfold and went to work at it. While he was visiting us, he did not complete the puzzle. He came close a few times, but in the end he ran out of time during his visit. He's already excited about coming back next month to try again! I feel confident that he will be able to get it next time. The cube is sturdy and very similar to what I remember as a child. It rotates easily. It's a well thought out version of the classic Rubik"s Cube!

title: Nice Beginner Set
text: This is a nice beginner Lego set. It's a simplified carnival scene from the new Toy Story movie. It comes with a Buzz Lightyear & a Little Green Alien minfigs. It's appropriately labeled for 4 years and up. The instructions are easy to follow. It doesn't take too long to put together from start to finish. It's a fun set!

title: Cute Star Wars Lego Set!
text: This is a cute Star Wars Lego set! It's a pretty fast one to put together as far as Lego sets go. It comes with 2 mini-figs - Wicket & a scout trooper. This is an action set which has shooters and you can actually knock down the tree if you hit the target. Because of that, it is a little more than just a "set". You have to rebuild it so you can shoot and knock it over again. Overall, it's a fun set!

title: Love the Variety of Body Types!
text: I am a long time Barbie fan. I loved playing with them when I was young, in the 70's. Then in the 90's I collected them. Then in the 2000's I bought them for my little girl. She's graduating from high school next month, but I still love Barbie! I got these for my 5 year old niece to play with when she visits us. I love the variety of body types in this set. I think that's one of the best changes to happen to Barbie ever! This set has 4 different dolls. There's the traditional Barbie that we all love. Then there's the curvy African American doll, a short, petite doll that looks like she could be Hispanic, and a tall , dark hair doll. The thing I love about them (their differences) is also slightly problematic. They all wear different size clothes/shoes. While, that's pretty normal in the real world, it's more difficult in the Barbie world. Some of the dolls could probably get away with sharing clothes, but curvy doll is out of luck. I hope to see more curvy doll size clothes in the future! And if you are planning to gift this, be aware that they don't come in the typical pink Barbie box. They're mounted on brown cardboard that folds into a box shape. There's no colorful pictures or a plastic window. Other than that, I think this is a wonderful set and has been long needed!

title: Wow!
text: This is an amazing Lego set! It took most of the afternoon for my 21 year old son and my husband to build. They did get interrupted a few times, so it wasn't continuous play. It's really an impressive set, especially for Avengers fans. Not only are there mini-figs for this set, but there's a micro-fig, too. Who knew?!?! It totally makes sense so Ant Man can be closer to his relative size. Another cool feature of this set is that you can actually shoot things. The pieces are tiny and may be lost easily, but it's something that you don't see in other Lego sets. Young builders will definitely need some adult help with this, but they'll have a lot of fun with it.

title: Fun Surprise for Llama Fans
text: This is a fun surprise for llama fans. You get two unknown llama personalities. I received Twirly Llama (a spitting one) and Dolly Llama (grinning one). They come with clothes/accessories. They may be a little challenging for young collectors, but with a little help, they can accomplish it. The grinning one doesn't really do much. The spitting one will spit water if you get the water inside. Other than that, they're really kind of basic figurines. They're cute, but something that may only be played with a few times.

title: Fun Set!
text: This is another fun set from Lego. It's a little different in that you're building a robot/machine thing instead of a place/set. It was fun nonetheless. It comes with 4 mini figs. The directions were clear and easy to follow. My 21 year old son built this with his 8 year old cousin recently. Once completed, it's pretty sturdy.

title: Beautiful!
text: This is a beautiful puzzle! The French street view is absolutely gorgeous! My family and I enjoy a good puzzle. I usually work on them the most, but my kids (ages 21 & 17) and husband can't resist helping out when I'm working on one. We usually do 500-1000 piece ones. This one was challenging, but not to the point of frustration. It did seem to take a bit longer to put the border together because of some of the piece shapes. There's enough color variation that we could usually figure out the placement. All the pieces were there. We've put together other Springbok puzzles and this was what we would expect from the brand.

title: Such a Cute Lego Set!
text: My 5 year old niece visits us a lot. She loves all things Disney Princesses. Princess Legos is something my 17 year old daughter will happily do with her. This has to be one of my favorite princess sets because of the flying carpet feature. It definitely delighted my niece! The set comes with an Aladdin and a Jasmine mini fig. The set is age appropriate for the recommended 5 and up group. My niece was able to build most of it, but she did need my daughter for guidance. My daughter would tell her what pieces to put together. My niece is already talking about building this set again the next time they visit.

title: Great Lego Set!
text: This is a smaller, but nonetheless fun, Star Wars Lego set. It's a 20th anniversary set which makes it a fun addition to any Star Wars collection. It comes with 5 minifigs - 4 are nameless characters, but it also comes with a Han Solo one. The instructions are easy to follow. My 21 year old son put this together without a lot of effort. The drop ship was one of his favorite Star Wars vehicles when he was younger, so it was fun for him to recreate it with Legos.

title: Fun Star Wars Lego Set
text: This is a fun Star Wars Lego set. My 21 year old son enjoyed putting it together.  The instructions are clear and concise. It didn't take more than an hour or so for my son to assemble it. Once he finished, he had some fun shooting the targets with it. The set comes with some unnamed minifigs and no big name characters. It is a little more complex than some of the more basic sets, but it's definitely something an older child could do. Overall, this is a much needed set for the Star Wars Lego fans!

title: Cute Lego Set!
text: This is a very cute Lego set. The addition of Disney princesses to the Lego line is a great idea! My daughter would have loved it when she was little. Now she's in high school, about to graduate, but she still enjoys building with Lego blocks. She has had fun playing with her 5 year old cousin and introducing her to the world of Legos! They recently built this set together when her cousin was visiting. It is age appropriate for the 5 year old. She was able to put it together mostly on her own, with a little help from my daughter. The directions were clear and easy to follow. You can easily add this to some of the other larger Disney princess sets.

title: Fun for All Lego/Marvel Fans!
text: My 17 year old daughter and her boyfriend put this together recently while hanging out at our house. They had fun building it. The directions were clear and easy to follow. It took them about 45 minutes to an hour from start to finish. The finished set looked great! This is fun for any Lego/Marvel fan!

title: Fun Lego Set!
text: My kids used to play Minecraft all the time. My 17 year old still plays it now and then. She had fun putting this Steve set together. Right now he's sitting on a shelf in her bedroom. The directions were easy enough to follow. It didn't take that long to assemble. This would be fun for any Minecraft fan!

title: Great Star Wars Lego Set!
text: My 21 year old son is a Star Wars fan as well as a Lego fan. His Lego days have slowed down, but when presented with a new Star Wars Lego set, he can't help but get to work on it. As far as Lego sets go, this one is a good one. The directions are clear and easy to follow. The finished set is now on display on a shelf in my son's room.

title: Fun Lego Surprise!
text: I have a 21 year old son and a 17 year old daughter. For the last several years, I have gotten them various Lego mini-fig surprises in their Christmas stockings and Easter baskets. They love the surprise element of it. My son has a display set up in his room with his favorite mini-figs. My daughter claimed this one. We haven't seen the new Lego Movie yet (but we will), but nonetheless she was excited to get this. She got Flashback Lucy and was pleased with it.

title: Such as Cute Set!
text: I love that Lego has been introducing the Disney princesses to the Lego World! My 5 year old niece visits us a lot. My kids are mostly grown, so we haven't had a lot of age appropriate toys for her. And when she doesn't have anything to do, she gets into things. This Lego set has kept her entertained well. She loves princess stuff, but because it is Lego, my children (her older cousins) and her older siblings have had fun playing with her.

title: Another Great Lego Set!
text: My young nieces and nephew visit a lot. I like keeping a few toys at my house to entertain them when they're visiting. Legos have a wide appeal and keep them busy for quite a while. It also bridges the gap between my youngest niece (5) and my son (21). I love it when they all build things together. This is a fun Disney Lego set. While it does have the Disney princess theme, even the boys enjoyed helping to assemble the castle. My son brought out some of his Star Wars Lego figurines and they created a whole new story line. This set was a little complicated for the 5 year old, but the recommended minimum age is 6. When she got frustrated, the older ones were there to help her. And once it was finished, she was delighted with the results. This is another great Lego set!!

title: Darling Lego Set!
text: This is a darling Lego set! I keep a bunch of Legos around for my nieces and nephew to play with when they're visiting. This a perfect set for my 5 year old niece. It's something that my own children will take the time to play with their young cousins. This is an age appropriate set. It's not too challenging. It's been a bit hit!

title: Entertaining!
text: My 17 year old daughter is obsessed with animals and especially predators. She has enjoyed reading through these cards and has even learned a few things. She had one of her best friends over recently, who shares the same love of predator animals. They played the game and seemed to really enjoy trying to outplay one another and selecting animals to challenge the other with.

title: Fun!
text: My 21 year old son is still a Pokemon fan. I thought he might enjoy this. He played a round or two, but then grew bored with it. My 17 year old daughter, who has minimal Pokemon knowledge, enjoyed playing with it more. It's a lot like the 20-Q game where you answer a series of yes and no questions then it guess what you're thinking. Most of the time when she played it, it guessed the correct answer. Since my daughter doesn't know a lot about the Pokemon subject, she found that she wasn't able to keep going after a while. We then shared this with my 8 year old nephew. He also has limited Pokemon knowledge. However, he started researching the Pokemon just so he could stump the gadget. He has been having a blast with it! So, I think if you get the right target audience, then it's a good form of entertainment. There is a finite number of Pokemon that you can work with though, thus limiting the game.

title: Fun Lego Set!
text: This is a fun Lego set for any Minecrafts fan. It's a small set and basically all you do is create the Alex character and the duck. It's age appropriate. It's a small set and would make a great birthday party gift. My only issue was that it arrived in a padded envelope and the set was crushed. All the pieces were fine though. If this had been a gift, I would have been disappointed.

title: Fun & Educational!
text: This has been a fun and educational card game. We've played this with our 8 year old nephew and 10 year old niece. The cards are interesting to read on their own as well. You rank your cards based on their statistics and predicting what your opponents will have. My nephew liked the cards so much that the kept reading them after the game was done!

title: Adorable Lego Set
text: My young nieces and nephew visit a lot so I like to have stuff for them to do when they're over. Legos are something that will entertain all 3 of them. Plus, my 17 year old will voluntarily play with them if they bring out the Lego tub. This is a cute, mini Lego set that introduces the world of Rapunzel. There is a larger Rapunzel Lego set sold separately. The Lego pieces are as expected. This set would fit in an Easter basket or Christmas stocking.

title: Cute Barbie Set!
text: This is a cute and unique Barbie play set. Barbie comes with chicken coop, chickens and some other farm accessories. My only complaint is that this arrived in a padded envelope and the outer plastic was crushed. It didn't harm any of the items in the set, but if you were planning on gifting this, it would be disappointing.

title: Fun Doll Set!
text: I love that Ken comes with the washing machine! Ken is a pretty basic male doll. He has molded/painted  hair. His clothes are pretty simple, so you'll probably need to get him some pants and real shoes. The flip flops that he comes with don't stay on his feet very well. The washing machine is really pretty cool. You can get it to "spin". Overall this is a fun doll set.

title: Cute Barbie Set!
text: I love this Barbie set! I wish it had been around when I was a kid. It comes with an assortment of music related accessories. I love the "You Can Be Anything" series of Barbies! I took music lessons all through school and I love that it encourages the performing arts!

title: Realistic Barbie Doll
text: This is a somewhat realistic Barbie doll! She's got some meat on her! Daisy comes with some fun accessories, including a kitty. She only comes with the clothes on her back. She won't fit in the standard Barbie clothing, so you will need to locate some designed for this curvy doll. I do like that her outfit is trendy looking and not frumpy! My only complaint or issue was that this was shipped in a padded envelope and arrived crushed. It didn't hurt any of the contents, but if you were ordering this as a gift, it would be disappointing.

title: Fun Accessory for Minecraft Fans
text: This is a fun accessory for Minecraft fans. It comes with one piece that clips onto your waist that allows you to attach other Minecraft items to it. The other 2 items are Minecraft "things" that can attach to the clip. The clip also works with other Minecraft items sold separately. They're made from a sturdy plastic. They don't really do anything, but it is fun to add these to your Minecraft creative play!

title: Fun for Minecraft Fans!
text: This is a fun playset for any Minecraft fan! My teenage daughter enjoys playing Minecraft with her younger cousins. She recently shared this with them and it was a big hit! It's sturdier than expected. It's plastic instead of foam like some of the other Minecraft stuff we have. It sort of functions like a fishing pool, but if you're expecting to act like a regular one, you may be disappointed. The younger kids had a blast with it and are looking forward to the next time they can play with it.

title: Lego Fun!
text: This Lego set is based on the upcoming second Lego Movie. It comes with 2 figurines, plus a plant creature and a dinosaur. The dinosaur has some additional options so it can be made into a vehicle (kind of like a Transformer without the ability to transform back and forth.) It doesn't take too long to assemble. The recommended age of 7+ is appropriate. This would be a great set for any young fans of the Lego Movies!

title: Great Kit!
text: My 17 year old daughter thought it would be fun to make bath bombs with her 10 year old cousin. My daughter already has a lot of the supplies (molds, etc), but my niece did not. The two girls spent a couple of hours making bath bombs using primarily this kit. My daughter did use some of her own molds so they could produce more bath bombs quicker. They used about half of the ingredients and made at least 6 different bath bombs. The ingredients included are easily found so you can make more. The girls had fun. Then we let the 10 year old take the kit home so she could make more bath bombs at home later. This would make a fun gift!

title: Beautiful Doll!
text: This is a beautiful doll! Jasmine is one of my favorite Disney princesses. The first thing I noticed about her is her long eyelashes! Her body can be posed in several different positions. Her outfit and accessories are nice and seem to be a decent quality. I compared her to another Jasmine doll which was a lot cheaper and side by side you can tell the difference. This deluxe doll has more details. Her clothing and accessories are more elaborate. This would be a great addition to any Disney princess fan's collection!

title: Perfect for Fans of My Little Pony!
text: This is an incredible set or should I say collection of My Little Pony characters. They ponies are larger than expected for this many ponies. I was thought for sure they would be the small sized ones. This should provide plenty of creative play for any fan of My Little Pony!

title: Fun & Addictive
text: This has been a lot of fun! I keep wanting to play it and beat my score. A light flashes and you have to press the most recent one.  You aren't repeating the whole sequence, just the last light. My high score is a not very high 15. I gave it to my 20 year old son and he was able to get every light correct which was 21. It comes with batteries, which is always a plus. It's quick and easy to play. I enjoy picking it up and playing a few rounds every now and then. It isn't very big, so you could carry it with you. I am always looking for ways to keep my brain sharp!

title: Entertaining
text: This is a fun play set for kids ages 4 and up. It's meant to be assembled and then demolished, then repeat. It's fairly easy to put together, but some younger kids may need some assistance. It come with 2 Matchbox vehicles. The quality is okay, not great. It's mostly plastic. It is entertaining though I don't know how many times it will take before it becomes boring.

title: Too Cute!
text: This Grinch Mega Blok set is just too cute! It's perfect for younger kids who aren't quite ready for the smaller blocks. There's not a whole lot to this set, it's a pretty simple layout. The blocks are a good size for small hands and easier to work with than the smaller ones. My 5 year old niece had no problems putting them together on her own. Since my nieces and nephew are much younger than my kids, I have been trying to gather an assortment of age appropriate toys for their visits. It just makes the visits go smoother. I will definitely be checking out more Mega Blok sets to have on hand.

title: Cute Portable Activity
text: My daughter had a similar play set when she was little. She enjoyed it, so I thought it would be a nice item to have on hand for when my niece comes over since it doesn't take up a lot of space. This one has some noticeable improvements to the set that my daughter had. The storage box of this has a handle which makes it easy to carry. The set that my daughter had did not. The handle makes it easier for small hands. My daughter had to carry the whole box in her hands which was a little awkward for her at times. Another feature that her set didn't have that this one does is it has little stands for the dolls to use so they can stand upright. She had to hold hers up if she wanted them to stand. The set comes with 2 dolls, 2 pets, and lots of clothing and accessories. Everything fits nicely into the storage case and it has a minimal footprint. This could easily be used in the car or put in a bag for times when you need to entertain your little one in a waiting room or similar place. The pieces are high quality and what you would expect from the Melissa and Doug brand.

title: Huge Size Gift Bag
text: Every now and then a super large gift bag is needed. This one is pretty darn big. I would say it's pretty comparable in size and material to a kitchen size trash bag. It's definitely nicer looking than the trash bag! It comes with a small gift tag and yarn to tie it up. This will work for over sized gifts that are difficult to wrap. It's not completely opaque, so you still need to be careful with items that may show through a little. Overall, it's a decent gift bag.

title: Entertaining
text: My sister's family was visiting recently. We love word games and found this to be entertaining. However, we were not fans with the idea of downloading an app to use it. I did download it, but after looking at what it was, we decided to use a timer and dice from another game. I have so many apps that are used for just one little thing that my phone feels cluttered! The game itself was pretty fun. We had 5 players. You need a minimum of 3 to play the game. The youngest player was 9, and she did fine with it. Overall it was fun, but ditch the app!

title: Fun Gift!
text: This llama string art kit would make a great gift for tweens! It comes with all kinds of craft supplies to make 2 string art boards. The instruction booklet is well written and includes lots of color photos to help you get started. My 17 year old daughter made these with her 9 year old cousin. The 17 year old found it to be a little easier, but the 9 year old held her own. Both girls decided to use their own creativity and made their boards a tad different than the photo samples. Overall, it's a fun activity and you end up with cute artwork for your room.

title: Fun!
text: This is just too cute! My family often adds "-ito" to words, so this goes right along with that. The tortilla looks real and is very soft. It was fun unwrapping it see what was hidden. You can easily wrap it back up because of the velcro. We got the bunny. The stuffed animal is cute, but kind of basic looking. It's definitely well made and much higher quality than would you would get in the claw machine or the dollar store. These would make fun birthday gifts.

title: Fun Activity
text: What a great activity!! Sewing is becoming a lost skill today, so I think kits like this are invaluable! This kit has everything you need to complete an adorable pillow. There are photograph instructions which are easy to follow. The whole thing took my 17 year old daughter and 9 year old niece a couple of hours to complete from start to finish, with the 9 year old doing most of the work. The finished product turned out really cute! I think this would make an excellent gift!

title: Poor Design
text: I thought this might be a fun activity for my 20 year old son to do with his 7 year old cousin since they both are fans of Nerf guns. The size of the target is much smaller than expected. The small size actually makes hitting it more difficult which made it less fun for the 7 year old. Batteries aren't included. There are 3 different play modes to chose from. The guys did seem to have fun, but the 3 second countdown was way too restrictive. Luckily, we had extra children around so we had them take turns pressing the button. It seemed to do a good job of keeping track of the scores. We didn't notice any problems there. Overall, it was okay. They did have fun, but they both grew bored with it after a short amount of time.

title: Large Pikachu
text: My 20 year old son was a huge fan of both Legos and Pokemon when he was younger. He still likes both of them, so I thought he might enjoy this. Mega Construx blocks are getting better. They've improved over the years. The instructions are still not as good as the competition, but my son found it easy enough to comprehend them so he could build his Pikachu. He built it over the course of several days when needing a break from studying. All of the pieces were included plus a few extras that he didn't end up needing.  It's definitely geared toward older kids. He even got a little frustrated at times during construction. The finished Pikachu is darling! It's not only big, but you can actually pose it. He's a little old for playing with it, but he's found a nice space for it on his book shelf.

title: Cute Diecast Cars!
text: These diecast cars are perfect for any Cars fan. They are comparable to other name brand diecast cars out there. They feel solid (not lightweight) and have vibrant graphics. They roll easily. I personally am only familiar with Lightning McQueen, but when I took this to show the autistic boy I work with, he quickly identified all of them. This would really make a nice gift!

title: Fun Game!
text: This is a fun game that relies more on luck than skill, though some skill is required. It's set up kind of like Battleship where the game board is two sided and in an upright position. You don't see your opponents board as you're playing. The actual game play is similar to Connect Four, but instead of 4 in a row, you're going for 5. It's fun playing with the various Harry Potter characters. The game itself is pretty easy to play. My 17 year old daughter has been playing this with her 9 year old cousin who is new into the Harry Potter world.

title: Fun for Large Groups
text: My 17 year old daughter has a group of friends that likes to get together for game nights. They have played Werewolf before and liked it. At first she was hesitant about this one because it was different. When she sat down and explored it, she decided it would be okay after all. She loves that up to 20 people can play this. Her group is usually much smaller than that, but more than the standard 4 person that many games max out at. She wasn't excited about having to download another app in order to play this, but in the end she felt that it really wasn't that big of deal. The app doesn't enhance the actual game play, but it does give you access to so many more words for the game. She and her friends played a few rounds of this. Each round is pretty quick. Overall, they had fun with it and isn't that one of the main objectives of playing a game?

title: Dress Up Fun!
text: Little girls (and boys) enjoy dress up. This is a fun set for the Fancy Nancy fans out there. The costumes are not super high quality, but they are comparable to other dress up clothes and costumes that I have seen. The accessories are a sturdier and made from plastic. There are several pieces so kids will have fun choosing their accessories. The storage trunk is just a cardboard box, but it is decorated to look like a trunk.  Overall, it's cute set that will inspire creative play. I do think it's a bit overpriced for what you get, but that's just my opinion.

title: Fun for Pokemon Fans!
text: My 20 year old so was a huge fan of both Legos & Pokemon when he was younger. He still enjoys both of those. Mega Construx sets have improved greatly over the years. While once considered inferior to Legos when they were known as Mega Blox, they have become quite comparable to them. This set wasn't too quick to assemble, but my son was able to complete it in one sitting. He found the directions to be fairly clear and simple to build. This was an entertaining set and the finished product looks pretty darn good.

title: Hours of Fun
text: My 17 year old daughter still plays Minecraft now and then. Her much younger cousins (7,9) are big fans, too, so this was given to them as a project to complete together. It occupied the 3 kids for most of the afternoon. The directions were easy to follow even with the variety of ages that we had going on here. After they completed it, they decided to make one of the alternative creations, too. The younger kids needed a little help from my daughter when it came to building it, but most of it they were able to do. This is perfect for any Minecraft fan!

title: Fun for Dinosaur Fans
text: My 17 year old daughter loves dinosaurs. She and a dino loving friend enjoyed this kit this afternoon. I had them work outside on the deck and I'm glad that I did. Boy, did they make a mess!! And they're both 17! I can only imagine how messy it might be for someone younger. We had another kit that so my daughter borrowed the excavating equipment from so they both could dig. It took them about an hour or so to get all of the raptor pieces out of the block. A couple of the pieces broke during the excavating. While they did have a lot of fun in the process, the end result was a little disappointing since they couldn't put the raptor together because of the broken pieces. This is a single use item. Because kids tend to have too many "things" these days, I'm okay with kits like this because it's not something that's meant to be kept. Though you could keep the dinosaur skeleton if you have all the pieces. This is more about the experience rather than the finished product.

title: Fantastic Details!
text: My kids were (and still are) fans of both Legos and Harry Potter. One is 17 and the other is 20.  They got together last weekend to put this fun set together. They divided and conquered. The details in this set are amazing! The moving brick wall on the platform is my favorite! There's even a chocolate frog for the snack cart. It's definitely geared toward the older children and teens. It took my kids a couple of hours to build this, but they did take some breaks. The directions were pretty easy to follow. I think they each had a moment or two of frustration, but since they were working together, they were able to help each other out. They haven't taken it apart yet, but they plan to carefully put everything in resealable bags so they keep all of the pieces together.

title: Fun!
text: My 17 year old daughter is currently obsessed with Jurassic World/Park and dinosaurs. I thought this would be a lot of fun for her. She was able to assemble the dino by herself in about thirty minutes.  The pieces are a sturdy flexible plastic. You have to download an app and then the step by step instructions are provided. I personally thought that was an ingenious way to do that. Once it was assembled, she was able to control the dino through the app. You can do things like change the color of lights in the eyes, move forward and backward, and more. You write little programs to get it to follow a chain of commands. There are challenges you can do that unlock various behaviors. We loved watching the cats' reactions to it. (They were not fans!). It comes with a USB cable for charging. There's a skin to go over the USB plug that looks like meat. The port to charge the dino is in the mouth, so it looks like you're feeding it meat! Sounds made by the dino go through the app. My daughter has been thoroughly enjoying her raptor. A younger child may need some guidance and assistance, but it's definitely within their ability. Overall, I would recommend this for any dinosaur fan who is interested in robotics or technology.

title: Fun Game for Groups
text: This game is reminiscent of an old TV game show. You read a card and fill in the blank with your own word or words. Then the other players try to guess what you filled in the blank. It comes with a buzzer for you to use instead of saying the word "blank" which is fun. My 17 year old daughter played this with a bunch of her friends at a recent game night. They had a lot of fun and did a pretty good job of keeping the answers clean or at least age appropriate. This game is for 4 + players. It is nice to have a game that has some flexibility in the number of players. My daughter had 9 friends over, and this worked well. It's hard to find games that can accommodate a lot of people.

title: Cute Activity
text: My 17 year old daughter had fun setting up this fairy garden with her almost 5 year old cousin. It comes with everything you need to set it up. It does not include the pebbles that are in the picture. Of course my niece wanted some so we had to find some to add. The items are plastic and safe for little kids to handle. It comes with just a few seeds, so they had to be careful not to lose any of them while working. My niece was a little disappointed that the plants didn't start sprouting right away. We let her take it home with her and she reported back to us a few days later that she saw something sprouting. She really likes her little garden and is thrilled with the little unicorn! This would make a fun birthday party gift.

title: Fun for the Mine craft Fan!
text: This mask is made from a durable plastic. Batteries are included which is always a plus. The eyes light up and the jaw can move. The mask is adjustable to accommodate head size. It fit my teen daughter's head pretty well, but it would fit a younger head better. I started to put it on and quickly changed my mind! Although my teen still plays Mindcraft now and then, she's been sharing this with her younger cousins who are obsessed with the game. They are 5, 9 & 10 and it's been a huge hit with them.

title: Well.......
text: These were a bit of a disappointment. They're made from cardboard and not very sturdy. I thought it would be fun to use with my 5 year old niece. Although she did seem to have fun with it, I really don't think it's going to hold up to a lot of play time. Not only that, the mask doesn't always move (operate) smoothly which led to a frustrated little girl. It's a fun concept and very goofy, which is really perfect for my niece, but she did lose interest rather quickly.

title: Cute & Colorful
text: These Sea Life puppets from Melissa & Doug are really cute. They're relatively simple, but adorable. The construction is good. The eyes are securely attached. All other facial features are printed directly onto the puppet so you don't have to worry about pieces coming loose. The fabric is really soft, but a little on the thin side. They easily accommodate adult hands as well as children's. There are no complicated movements to be made, so the ages 2 and up is appropriate. They are machine washable which is nice. The set includes a shark, sea turtle, octopus, and dolphin.

title: Great for Nerf Fans!
text: My 20 year old son still enjoys playing with Nerf guns. He's had several over the years and agrees that this is definitely the most accurate one he has used. He was also impressed with the shooting range, especially when compared to some of the other models. It's longer than it needs to be and a lot of the added length is just for looks. Overall, he likes it and thinks it's a worthy addition to the Nerf product line.

title: Entertaining Little Toy
text: My 17 year old daughter is obsessed with dinosaurs. She has been amused by this little Raptor. It makes lots of different sounds. She loves the tamed mode and getting him to fall asleep in her hand. It works as described and would appeal to younger children or goofy teenagers. She wants to get one of these for her 8 year old cousin for his birthday this fall.

title: Fun for All Ages
text: I ordered this with the intent that my 17 year old daughter would do this activity with her 9 year old cousin. Instead, my daughter made them with her 17 year old friends! They had so much fun making their own marker colors. The directions were clear and easy to follow. It wasn't messy. They really got into the naming of their colors. I was impressed with their creativity. The finished markers can be clipped on a bag or backpack. My daughter says she's going to bring these to school. The markers are slightly scented, but it's not over powering. She did save about half of the supplies so hopefully she'll have the chance to make some with her cousin.

title: Required Additional Props that We Didn't Have With Us
text: We played this recently with friends. There were six of us, 4 adults (2 couples) and two 17 year olds. The premise of the game was intriguing, but quickly lost our interest. We were not at home when we were playing, so that proved to be difficult. Many of the activity cards require you to go get something before you can begin the challenge. Items included a button down shirt, keys, a pen, and more. We had to keep skipping some of the challenges because we didn't have any access to the requested items. We did laugh a little and had fun, but when we were finished, we all just kind of agreed that it was just okay and none of us really had any interest in playing it again. The teens were amused by the tiny hands. I definitely think this game appeals more to teenagers and tweens than adults.

title: Simple But Fun !
text: This is not only a fun game to play, but it is easy to set up. There is no game board or game pieces. There are no complicated instructions. I love the simplicity of it. It's for 2 or more players. You keep track of the score on the included score sheets. The question cards are two sided so there are plenty of questions to choose from. Some of the questions are harder than others which only makes the game play a little more challenging. It says that it's for ages 12 and up, but my kids fall into that range and they wouldn't have any fun with it because they don't know a lot of 80's and 90's stuff. However, my peer group is a different story. We were able to take a nice trip down memory lane while playing it.

title: Fun in the Pool!
text: This is not your Walmart pool float! I am very impressed with how heavy duty it is. When I compared it to a promotional float that my daughter got recently, it's significantly sturdier and thicker than hers. It was easy to inflate with our electric air pump. I really liked the mesh covering on the bottom that keeps you from falling all the way through it. Another thing I really like is the back rest. You have to get yourself in the right position to be comfortable, but once you're there, it's pretty good. And of course the cup holders are a nice feature, too. My daughter and I fought over who got to use this at the pool. I may have to get another one. I definitely think this is a pool type float and would be hesitant to use it on a lake or river, but that's just a personal opinion.

title: Fun Pool Toy!
text: This has been a big hit with my teenage daughter and her friends this summer. They've been playing with it the way it suggests - one person throws the diving toys into the pool, then one person goes in with the net and tries to scoop up all the diving toys before they sink to the bottom. Depending on how many people are playing, someone keeps time so they know who is the fastest. The pieces are sturdy yet flexible. The decorations are cute and appealing.

title: Unique Game for Up to 8 People
text: This is a unique and interesting game. My family of four (mom, dad, 20 year old son, & 17 year old daughter) played it first. Overall the consensus was that the game was okay. You can play with up to 8 players. The instructions were clear enough to follow. But our game experience was just mediocre. My son later took this to play with his college friends. They had a blast! They really got into the whole "Mr. Game" role and making up rules and such. My son took a game design class last year and he found all the elements of this game to be well crafted. One of the differences between the family group and his friends, is that our family tends to play more cooperative games such as Pandemic, Ticket to Ride, and Settlers of Catan. My son's group of friends are a lot more competitive. Since one group of players really liked it and the other was just "meh", I split the difference to give it my rating. For the right group, this can be a lot of fun.

title: Quick Game Play
text: This game has become a favorite of my 16 year old daughter. She brings it out every time a friend comes over and has played it multiple times already. The box is pretty small, so she's even taken it with her on occasion.  The illustrations on the cards are cute and funny. There are enough different cards that every game is new. The game moves pretty quickly and it can be completed in less than 30 minutes. I have played it once and found it to be okay, but slightly confusing, but my daughter just loves it!  And in full disclosure, there are lots of modern games out there that confuse me these days! It's definitely appealing to teens.

title: Different Than the Original Thomas Trains, But Still Fun to Play With
text: My son loved playing with his Thomas train set. He's twenty now,  but we've kept his train set for our nieces and nephew to play with while visiting and for future grandchildren.
