My 8 year old nephew compared this newly designed Gordon to the original one while visiting us recently. Side by side, this one is a little shorter in length. It moves similarly to the original. One thing that that my nephew said that I thought was particularly interesting was that it looks more like the real Gordon than the older one. As far as working with the older set, he was pleased that it works with the other trains and track without any problems. It comes with adapter track pieces which would be needed if you wanted to combine tracks. We have plenty of original wooden ones, so we probably won't need them, but we did try them out and they worked fine. The new design seems durable. I'm not really sure why the trains were redesigned, but if you are new to the Thomas world I think these are fine. I don't think most kids are going to mind the changes. They are going to see it as a fun toy.

title: Fun Family Game
text: Kaiju Crush is a relatively easy game to play. It says it's for ages 10 and up, but we played it with our 8 & 9 year old niece & nephew and it was fine. The game follows the "rock, paper, scissors" format. It involves both luck and some strategy. The game play rules are well written and easy to follow. They include some illustrations that are helpful when figuring out the game. The kids had a lot of fun playing it and had the opportunity to get a little silly when attacking the cities and crushing the buildings. It took about thirty minutes to play the game from start to finish.

title: Great for Travels!
text: This is a nice quality sticker activity set, similar to what you might find in a museum gift shop or high end toy store. The stickers are a little difficult to remove from the sheet, but they are definitely thicker and sturdier than regular stickers. The background is cute and stable. It is pretty easy to move the stickers around on the background. It's a colorful and engaging activity and would be great for entertaining a child on a trip or at a restaurant because packs flat and you don't have to worry about losing pieces. While the stickers are removable and can be rearranged, I don't think it would hold up indefinitely.

title: Great for Card Collections
text: The Ultra Pro binder is my son's favorite for storing his Magic the Gathering cards. This is his second one. It keeps the cards protected and allows you to view them safely.

title: Doesn't Really Launch, But Still Provided Giggles
text: My nieces and nephew (ages 4, 7, & 9) are obsessed with poop and poop toys. I thought they would have fun with this. I was right, they did. However, it was kind of a let down regarding the launcher. It didn't really launch the poop as expected. That didn't stop my nieces and nephew from lots of giggling. This is currently listed at $12.97 which I think is way over priced. This is something I would expect to see at a discount store at a discounted price.

title: Unique Set
text: I love seeing LEGO sets that don't have any movie or character tie-ins. This set reminds me of some of the older LEGO sets. There are lots of construction toys, but the forest tractor is unique as far as children's toys go. The instructions are easy to follow. It's definitely appropriate for the recommended 5-12 age.  The tree is a little small for the set in my opinion, but that's not a deal breaker. This would be a great set for any young LEGO fan.

title: Great Set for Girls!
text: This is a great LEGO set for girls! I love seeing a roll model that encourages girls to like Science. The details in this set are awesome! I love the coffee machine and the little robot is very cute. Instructions are fairly easy to follow. The quality is what you would expect from LEGO. I really like seeing non-girly sets for girls!

title: Quick Paced
text: Once you get started, this is a pretty quick paced game. The directions were very entertaining to read, but a little confusing. We only had 3 players, so we were referred to a later page in the manual for some adjustments. Some of the adjustments didn't really make any sense with just 3 players. The game play would definitely work better with 5 or 6 players for full game play. There's a lot of humor added to the instructions. While entertaining, it took longer to figure out how to play. My daughter compared the game to Would You Rather. We completed the game in less than thirty minutes. The game pieces are a decent quality. Plastic baggies are included for storing the pieces. Some of the questions were very similar to others and we thought we had a duplicate on on a couple occasions. We plan to give it another try with a larger group.

title: Quick Assembly
text: The Adora Doll Wardrobe is an affordable alternative to a large, expensive wooden piece of doll furniture. It's similar to the fabric storage bins in design. It arrived flat and didn't take very long to assemble. It's not as sturdy as a wooden one, but there are cardboard pieces that do help to stabilize it when in place. There's a fabric loop from the top which I think is meant to hang clothes. There are a couple of shelves and drawers for additional storage. It doesn't hold a whole lot of items, so if you have a lot of doll clothing and accessories, this isn't really a storage piece, it's more of a play set.

title: Cute Doll Set!
text: The Enchantimals Friendship Set is a cute doll set for children ages 4 and up. I wasn't familiar with Enchantimals, but I looked it up and it's a new TV show on Nick Jr. I think this would be great for young girls who aren't quite ready for Barbies or other more adult looking dolls. These dolls are smaller than Barbie and not as sexy or busty. The plastic is fairly rigid, but a little more flexible than Barbie's plastic arms. The dolls have painted swimsuit style outfits with removable fabric skirts over that. The dolls have some kind of footwear, too.  Each doll comes with a coordinating animal friend that also has hair. This is a great starter set for any Enchantimals fan.

title: Great Way to Introduce Simple Sewing Skills
text: My daughter loves crafts! I thought this would be fun for her to do with her younger cousin. First of all, it doesn't come with any decorating supplies. To be honest, I am totally fine with that. We have a lot of craft supplies and I actually get annoyed when craft kits include cheap paints, glitter pens, or markers because my child would insist on using that inferior craft stuff than the nicer quality supplies we already have at home. It comes with enough supplies to make 7 little hearts. Each heart has a side made of felt and another one that's plastic. The plastic is light weight and flexible. It reminds me of a report cover or poly folder. I think this is a nice way to introduce kids to simple sewing skills. The hearts are on the small side, but would make nice ornaments. I think this is a decent craft kit, but it could definitely be a little disappointing to some. And if you don't have much in the way of craft supplies of your own, you will be very limited to what you can do.

title: Fun Assortment of Stickers
text: I jumped on the the whole planner craze a few months ago. I used to scrapbook, but haven't had time for that since I went back to work full time three years ago. Planners allow me to be creative on a much smaller scale. Since I started, I have become obsessed with finding the right stickers for my pages. I would be mortified if my husband found out how much I have spent on stickers an washi tape so far! This set of stickers has 3 pages. The pictures in the product description are quite accurate. The gold and copper colors are shiny metallic. They are professionally made as opposed to something just printed out on someone's personal printer. It's a nice assortment of fun sticker accents for your planner.

title: Great for Smaller Hands
text: This Kid K'Nex building set is definitely what you would expect from the K'Nex line of toys. This set comes with 115 pieces and 60 different ideas of creatures to build. From the picture on the box, I was expecting to be able to create several different pals at the same time, but there are only enough eyes for 2 pals at any one time or 3 if you have 2 pals with a single eye. There are some pieces that flex and some that are firm. The instruction sheet has pictures to show you how to connect the various pieces, but it does not show you how to make any of their suggested pals. It does show 60 different finished pals, but not how to make them. The pieces are larger than the standard K'Nex and the recommended age range seems appropriate.

title: Not Really Wheel of Fortune or Bingo
text: I love Wheel of Fortune and Bingo, but the Wheel of Fortune Bingo game is really not Wheel of Fortune or Bingo. You spin the wheel to determine what letter to cover with a cube. There are a few letter choices per spin and you select one of them. The first person to completely cover their phrase or word on their card wins the round. The wheel spins well. You remove the top of the wheel to store all the game pieces. I thought that was pretty nifty. The little cubes are really small and a little difficult to handle. The phrases are all spelled out for you, so there's no figuring out. Overall, we found the game to be just okay. My sixteen year old daughter thinks it will be fun to play with her younger cousins (ages 7 & 9).

title: Creative Game
text: My teenage daughter loves games. I thought this would be something different. Basically, you wear special headphones while your teammate whispers a phrase. You try to figure out what the phrase is by reading lips. The headphones require batteries. You press a button on one of the ear cups, and it starts playing a somewhat noisy and annoying background sound. There is a timer feature built in, so the noise stops after a minute has passed which signals that your turn is over. The headphones don't feel very sturdy, but they are okay. There are 600 cards which have four phrases on each card. We found it difficult to hear the whispering when wearing the headphones, which is desired. If you correctly guess the right phrase, you get to keep the card which is later counted as points. Team with the most points at the end wins. There's instructions for playing with 4 to 8 people as well as for just two. It was funny what some of us thought was being whispered! My daughter is looking forward to playing this at her next game night with friends.

title: Great Details!
text: This is an impressive play set. It's sturdier than I expected. On the outside it looks like BB-8, but when it opens, it becomes a multi-level set. Some assembly is required and batteries are not included. It comes with two action figures, but I wasn't really sure who they were. I've seen the movie, but these characters are not the ones I remember. The action figures seem to be about the same size as the ones my husband grew up with in the eighties. I haven't gotten them out of storage for comparison yet. The details of the play set are pretty good. The sound effects are realistic and a fun addition. This is perfect for any young Star Wars fan!

title: Fun in the Classroom!
text: I work in a high school special ed classroom. The students are considered to be moderate-intellect. I took this game in to play with some of them. The game can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players. Each player gets a set of 12 "eye" cards. There are two cards of each eye color, but one is a left side of the face and the other is the right side. You have to physically pick up the panda board to shake the dice. At first I thought it was like the old classic game Trouble where you press on the dome to get the dice to move, but that's not how it works. After the dice are rolled, you find the two cards in your pile the match what shows up on the panda board. It took one of my students a while before she started "getting" that the left/ride side mattered, but my other student picked up on it fairly quickly. I ended up with a set of cards, too, and I would position it correctly and model it for the one student to copy. The first person to have the correct eye match, wins a tile. We ended up playing three full games. Both kids liked it a lot. Although they are in high school, it was very appropriate for their academic levels. There's no reading, so we weren't slowed down by that. I would definitely recommend this to other special ed teachers or people with preschoolers.

title: Fun New Word Game!
text: I'm a fan of word games such as Scrabble and Boggle, so this game is just up my alley. I love that it works for 2, 3, or 4 players. The first time I played it with my teenage daughter. The first one to score 44 points wins. The game goes pretty quickly.  The more we played, the more strategizing we would come up with. During the first couple of rounds, I didn't give much thought into where I put my letter tiles. Then I started to look ahead at the upcoming letters and I would come up with words much quicker. The next time we played, my husband joined us. The only criticism that I have of the game is regarding the scoring. You move the pegs to represent your score total. I just found it hard to read the numbers. The numbers are the same blue as the board. I had to pick up my board a few times to bring it closer so I could read it. I may just keep score on paper next time to make it easier for me. Other than that, the game was a lot of fun to play!

title: Great Set for Girls!
text: I love seeing building sets geared towards girls! This set is fun for any Monster High fan. The instructions weren't too complicated  - actually a little better than some other Mega Construx sets we've had in the past. It's recommended for ages 7 and up, but it is a little difficult for young hands to assemble. My 8 year old niece needed help from my teenagers. It may be more of a lack of experience on her part. The finished product is cute and it does work, though it did require repair work after a few rotations. Overall, it's a cute set.

title: Finally a Kitty That Won't Run When You Try to Pick it Up!
text: Many years ago, my now 16 year old daughter had a similar type kitty toy, but this updated kitty does a lot more. My daughter's kitty toy purred and mewed when petted. It was the same firm type body with fur. This one makes a lot more sound, it's tail moves, and the eyes move. My four year old niece thinks this kitty is the best! It doesn't run from her when she's trying to play with it and it lets her pick it up! There's been a minimal amount of shedding, but that is something the we've seen with other long haired stuffed animals when played with. I do think this is a bit expensive for what it does. Batteries are included, but I don't know how frequently they will need to be replaced. It takes 4 -AAA. Overall, it's cute, but over priced.

title: Easy to Set Up
text: My family is into all kinds of video games, so I thought this might be fun to play with. My husband still has his original Atari 2600 console, but this is definitely easier to set up. There are only ten games on this emulator. Centipede was the closest to the actual game play in my husband's opinion. Some of the other games were more difficult to play because the joy stick doesn't have the track ball which the original Atari had and many of those games utilize that function. My husband thought the Asteroid game was neat because it was in color where it was originally in black and white. I let my 6 year old nephew play it and he did pretty well with it. I think it helped that he had never played the original and didn't know that the track ball even existed.

title: Great for Mario & NES Collectors
text: This is a great, collectible NES/Mario figure. It really doesn't do much, other than light up, but it's super cute! My 19 year old son has been a fan of Mario since he was about 3 or 4 years old. He's now in college studying video game design. This is a fun, decorative piece for his room. Batteries are not included. Supposedly there's a USB adapter you can purchase separately.  Of course, it would have been nice if it came with the adapter. It lights up well and is pretty bright when it is turned on. I wasn't familiar with the Pixel Pals before, but now that I have seen one up close and personal, I am going to look into some of the others for my son. I think it would be a great holiday gift for him.

title: Great Set!
text: My 19 year old son still enjoys building with Legos, plus he loves Halo, so I thought this would be a fun way to get him off of the computer for a while.  He has some of the smaller Halo Mega Block sets from a few years ago that he enjoyed building. He has those displayed on a shelf in his bedroom. He's also built some other more recent Mega Construx sets. One complaint or issue he has had with some of the other sets is that the instructions were not as clear or concise as Lego instructions. He felt that the instructions for this set were actually pretty good. The structure is fairly large and the details are great. It's definitely geared toward older children or teens. He really likes this and has cleared off some room on his shelf to display it.

title: Young Barbie Fans Will Enjoy It
text: I have been a Barbie fan since I was a child, many years ago. My now 16 year old daughter was a huge fan when she was young. I even have several "in the box" collector Barbies. The Barbie Dreamtopia Sweetville Kingdom Carriage just doesn't seem as high quality as the many Barbie products I have purchased over the years. It's definitely not a collector's item. The price is decent and you get a complete set of a doll, unicorn, and carriage. The plastic carriage flexes when you apply pressure. It doesn't feel like it's going to easily break, but it's not as rigid as other Barbie products. The carriage door opens and closes.  The wheels rotate easily and give a pretty smooth ride. The details on the carriage are nice. There are lots of textures to make it more realistic.  The unicorn is a sturdier plastic piece. The doll has the rigid, no bend legs. Her facial details are what you expect on Barbies. She has a removable crown. Her top is molded plastic and not removable. Her skirt is a cute, candy print fabric, but the material itself is stiff and doesn't flow or move. In fact, I don't like the skirt at all. Overall, it's an attractive looking set, but the quality is disappointing. With all that said, I think young Barbie fans would probably still enjoy it.

title: Great Looking Finished Product!
text: As with most other Mega Construx/Mega Blocks sets, this is a fun set. For the most part, they are comparable to Legos in most ways. One of the biggest differences is with the instructions. And this is no exception. The instructions are just not as clear or as easy to follow as Legos. The instructions are not impossible, just not as user friendly. A younger builder might have some frustrations with part of the assembling.  This set is labeled for ages 8 and up. I got this for my 19 year old son. He is still fond of Pokemon and Legos. Mega Construx/Mega Blocks always seems to have some really cool tie-ins that they work with that Lego doesn't, with Pokemon being one of them. My son built this for display purposes. He keeps it on a shelf in his bedroom. The finished Charizard looks great! My son does think that it might break easily when playing with it. Overall, a fun construction/block set.

title: Finished Product Looks Great!
text: My 19 year old son loves Legos and Pokemon. I thought he might have fun with this Mega Construx set. At his age, he likes to build and then put it on his shelf, so that's what he has done with this. The building part was a little more complicated than Legos. The instructions weren't as clear as what you get with those sets. He said the instructions were just okay. However, he's very pleased with the end results. A much younger builder might have some difficulties with this. It says it's for ages 8 and up, but that seems way too young.  The Gyarados poses well and looks awesome!

title: Creative Game!
text: We own a few different Cranium games, but not this one. My daughter had played it before, but the rest of us had not.  The description says it is for ages 16 and up. At first, I thought that might be a bit off, but after playing it, I agree with that.  It also requires at least 4 people to play, so we had to wait until all four of us were available. Our players were my husband and I, along with our sixteen year old daughter and 19 year old son. The game itself is pretty creative. The instructions were okay, but there were a couple of times when clarification would have been helpful. For example, the first couple of cards we played, one of the teammates read the card. Then we had one card come up that it didn't make sense for anyone on that team to see the card in advance, so we started having the opponents read the cards. The questions and activities were fun. My daughter enjoyed the play-doh activities. I wish it came with a small laminated type card or mat to use with the play-doh. I didn't want to use it directly on our dining room table, so the first time it came up, we used it on a piece of paper. A lot of it stuck to the paper and we couldn't get it off. There are some multiple choice questions, true and false statements, drawing, sculpting, humming, & acting involved. I had to hum Bohemian Rhapsody to my daughter! The game was fun, but a lot more difficult than we expected. Both teams were stuck on the board for a while because of incorrect answers. I think this would be better suited to larger groups or a party setting. Overall, we liked it, but didn't love it.

title: Geared Toward Older Kids
text: I got this kit for my nineteen year old son. He was able to put most of it together on his own, but he does lack patience at times, so my husband did help out. It took them most of an afternoon to do so. It would definitely be troublesome for most younger kids. My son has had fun shooting the paper wads, but he's not so good about cleaning up afterwards. If you look at this as more of a model kit and building project rather than a functioning toy gun, I think you will be happier. My son keeps his propped up against his wall more than actually shooting with it.

title: Fun Assortment of Princess Dress Up!
text: This is a fun assortment of princess costumes and accessories. The quality of the costumes is actually better than I anticipated. It's definitely a costume/play quality, but it's not the super thin, cheap dress up clothes you would get in the toy section of the local store. The details on the dresses is nice. I really like the variety of styles. My almost four year old niece is having a lot of fun with these. The sizes are all different. The purple one barely fit my niece. The yellow one fit around her well, but was a tad long. Of course, that didn't discourage her from dressing up at all. All of the items have Velcro so little hands can easily dress themselves. Each dress comes with a tiara and wand. The product description says it comes in a storage box. Well, it arrived in a box within a box, but the inner box isn't really a storage box. It's a white, cardboard box with a taped picture of the princess gowns on it.

title: Fun Family Game
text: I have two teenagers who spend a lot of time in their rooms. We have the occasional game night once or twice a month for some quality family time. This game has become my 16 year old daughter's absolute favorite game. She has even started having her friends over for game night. You roll the dice and whatever letter comes up is the letter that each word that you write has to start with for that round. You are given a card that tells you what to write. For example, the card may say "a color" for number 1. The die was rolled and it landed on the letter G for that round. So you have to write down a color that starts with G on your list. Now if you and anyone else write the same G word, neither of you get a point. You are trying to come up with the most original and creative word that fits the letter and the subject. It's usually hard to come up with all twelve words in a round when the timer is set! We all enjoy this game!

title: Lots of Fun!
text: My family enjoys playing games. We discovered cooperative ones a few years ago and those have become our favorite. We weren't sure what to expect with the 5 Minute Dungeon game, but we really had fun playing it. You can have up to 5 players. It was my husband and me, plus our two teenagers and one visiting teen. Each round takes up to 5 minutes and there are 5 rounds to the game. My 19 year old son was the one who read the directions and told us what to do. I had problems keeping it all straight, but everyone else seemed to understand. Once the game was underway, I quickly understood and was able to join in without any difficulties. Most of our rounds took about 4 minutes, though one round ended up with just fourteen seconds left when we were done. The game is really quick and slightly chaotic. It got a bit messy in between rounds because we were just throwing the cards down on the table when we played them, but it was pretty fast to sort them back in between rounds because they are color coded. After the first round, my 16 year old daughter was the first one to say how fun she thought it was. That was unexpected because she was the least excited about playing it in the first place. The family has already decided that this is a game we'll take with us on our next beach/cabin trip.

title: Fun Lego Set
text: My college aged son still enjoys playing with Legos. He's a Star Wars fan, so this set was very entertaining for him. He's home from school on summer break and this took him an afternoon to assemble. Even though he's over the recommended age, he still had fun with it. He thought it was cool to have an "old" Han Solo figurine. It's pretty much what you would expect as far as large Lego sets go. It's not as complicated as the Death Star, but it does take a few hours to build it all.

title: Great for Students
text: Just as expected. Color variety is good. I purchased these for student use in my classroom. When comparing other inexpensive colored pencils for students, these are the best.

title: Nice Quality
text: I ordered these sleeves for my teenage son. He is using them for his "special" Magic the Gathering cards. They are sturdy and offer good protection to his favorite cards. The image is clear and printed nicely.

title: Fun Game
text: I did not realize that this was an explicit version of the game. I have two teenagers and we have played this as a family. Although explicit, it wasn't "too" bad. If I had noticed, I probably would have ordered the original. For the most part, we weren't reading the details of the cards, we were concentrating on looking for matches. I wasn't offended by any of the cards personally. I would compare it to potty humor or what you might expect from a teenage boy. The game itself is fun to play. The instructions are easy enough to follow and understand.

title: Fun Game
text: My daughter wanted this for Christmas. I've played the game before, but we have never owned it. I was telling her about the buzzer feature and was surprised to learn that there is no buzzer. Instead, there is a plastic vinyl squeezable squeaker instead. We were playing it at a friend's house and their dog was very interested in the squeezer. It's very similar to a dog squeeze toy. So we had to be careful with it and put it away when not in use. The game play was pretty much how I remembered it. It's a fun game for groups.

title: Great Addition to the Collection
text: I bought this for my 19 year old son for Christmas. He was thrilled with it. He can't wait for the new semester to start up so he can use it the next time he plays with his dorm friends. It was just as expected and arrived promptly and safely.

title: Great Assortment of Colors!
text: I work in a special education classroom with an autistic teenage boy. He loves to color and prefers colored pencils for his coloring. He is very particular about his colors and will get agitated if he doesn't have the right shade of a color. I keep this set of colored pencils for those times when his 24 pack of colors doesn't have the color that he needs. The assortment is excellent and has lots of those very specific colors that he wants for some of his art work. He applies a lot of pressure as he colors and the leads seem to hold up well to his use.

title: Cute Barbie Play Set
text: I have been a Barbie fan since I was a kid. There's just something about Barbie that I am fascinated with. The Barbie Sparkle Style Salon Set comes with a Barbie and the salon booth. The Barbie is blonde with pink highlights framing her face. The hair feels like traditional Barbie hair. She's wearing a cute dress paired with adorable black flats. She is jointed at her wrists and knees for decent movement range. The quality of the salon booth is average. It's plastic doll furniture and definitely comparable to other Barbie furniture. This set is unique because water use is encouraged. Instructions are included showing you how everything works. The glitter brush isn't particularly big, so it won't take long before it gets used up. This set will provide hours of creative play. For the price, it's on par with other Barbie play sets.

title: Great Improvements to a Classic Toy!
text: This Lincoln Logs Centennial set brings back a lot of memories. I remember playing with my mom's old set of Lincoln Logs when I was a child. I wasn't sure what kind of changes or improvements could be made to this classic toy, but the improvements that I've noticed are really for the better. The actual logs are solid and compressed. I remember my mom's old set was chipped in a few places, particularly the notches. These don't look like they will chip at all. The old ones were flat, matte whereas these are sealed and slightly glossy for added protection. I expected the plastic to be light weight and cheap, but it's heavy duty and very comparable to what I remember as a child. The shingles are plastic now instead of wood and so are the animals and figures. There is a nice assortment of pieces. The instruction booklet gives you step by step details on how to build your own cabin as well as pictures of other finished ones. I love that it comes in a metal tin. My mom's old set was a cardboard container that didn't hold up well over the years. It says that this is for ages 3 and up, but I plan to give this to my 6 year old nephew for Christmas. I think he'll get more out of the actual building and construction than a younger child would.

title: Super Soft!
text: My teenage daughter is obsessed with dinosaurs. She was thrilled to receive this recently. The pastel turquoise color matches her bedroom decor. The dinosaur is super soft. It's monochromatic where as the photos show that the spikes are a contrasting color. If you look at the last picture where the little girl is hugging it, that is more accurate as to what it looks likes in person. The construction is well made and it lives up to the Manhattan Toy name. The feet are weighted with some type of sandy substance so it can stand up better than a lot of stuffed animals. My daughter keeps this dino on her bed, along with her Twenty-One Pilot Pillow. It says it's good for all ages - I don't have any young ones at home, but my 15 year old loves it!

title: Nicely Made
text: My teenage son asked me to order him a case to store his Magic the Gathering cards. This one can accommodate 1500 cards and can be divided into 6 separate compartments. The case is a hard zippered case. The zipper works well and is sturdy. The dividers flex a bit, but they are pretty strong, too. They attach to the interior of the case with velcro. They can be rearranged in different ways if needed. There is a handle on the top of the case for carrying it. Overall, my son is very pleased with it and for the time being, it holds all of his cards.

title: Lots of Fun!
text:
I work in a special ed middle school classroom. I took these to class during the last week of school. The kids had a blast with these! The balls are a little smaller than I expected. I didn't measure them, but they seemed smaller than the advertised 12 inches. Some of them were harder than others to inflate, but they all inflated. There are 6 different designs with 2 of each.

*I purchased these at a discounted price in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Basic Spider Rings
text: My family enjoys Geocaching and we just started making our own caches. My daughter wants to make a themed one based on spiders. She thought it would be fun to leave spider ring trinkets so the people who find our cache could take one. These spider rings are perfect for that. They are basic plastic spider rings. The detail on the spiders is not as good as some spider rings that I have seen, but since we were shopping for spider rings off season, it didn't surprise us. There was some excess plastic left behind on a few of the spiders. But for our purposes, these will do the job.

title: Fun Activity!
text:
Since the Jurassic World came out this summer, my 14 year old daughter has been obsessed with dinosaurs. I thought she might enjoy assembling and painting her own. The pieces are a sturdy, light weight wood. They were easy to punch out of their sheets. Overall it was easy to assemble, but there were a few pieces that were more difficult to put in place and they had to be pushed very hard to fit. The paint pots are very small, so you definitely have to paint it in a rainbow style. The paint brush that is included is nothing fancy, but it does the job. It didn't take very long for my daughter to assemble it. The painting is taking longer. The finished product is sturdy.

*I received this puzzle for free for the purpose of trying out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Fun & Challenging
text:
These are fun, challenging brain teasers The objective is to get the ring off and then replace it back. I was surprised by how sturdy these are. I thought they might be soft enough that you could bend them a little, but that's not the case. Unless you get some pliers or other tools, you cannot squeeze them in order to slide the ring off. My husband and I played around with them for at least 20 minutes last night & we both were able to solve only one of the three puzzles. There are no hints or answers provided.

*I received these for free for the purpose of trying out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Adorable!
text: This is too cute! I ordered this for my 2 year old niece. She loves cats & stuffed animals, so I thought this would be a nice Christmas gift. The house is a little smaller than I expected, but it's a good size. There are 3 little kitties. They are finger puppets, but they're more of a little stuffed toy with a sleeve on their bellies so you can slide your finger in it. The kitty rests on your finger in a horizontal fashion. There were no loose threads or dangerous parts. Definitely appropriate for my niece.

title: Cute Outfits!
text: This is a sweet set of Barbie outfits and accessories. The dress is adorable! Overall, it's a good value. The outfits don't look to be very high quality, but it does seem on par with today's Barbie fashions. I ordered this for a gift for my niece.

title: Cute Barbie Outfit
text: This is a cute Barbie dress with accessories. It doesn't look like it's super high quality, but I think that's on par with Barbie clothes these days. I ordered this as a gift for my niece and it met my expectations. For the price, it was a good value.

title: Easy Velcro Closure!
text:
I used to teach preschool and I've seen some good art smocks and some bad ones. This one is a good one! It's made of a plastic vinyl type material so it will paint will easily wash off. There are large pockets on the front and elastic at the wrists. My absolute favorite part about this smock is that there is a velcro closure on the back. When I taught preschool, we always had ones that had to be tied. Those were impossible for small kids to take off by themselves. I plan to give this to my sister who has 3 young children.

*I received this directly from Mudder for the purpose of trying out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Quality Colored Pencils for the Classroom!
text: I work in a Special Needs classroom with a couple of autistic boys who love to color with colored pencils. They tend to use certain colors more often and then because of the firm pressure that they use when coloring, we are constantly out of those certain colors. This week, one of the boys nearly had a meltdown because we didn't have the right shade of blue. This set of 8 colors allows us to restock the blues, reds, black, browns, and yellows that we go through the most without adding more of the colors we aren't using as quickly. I would buy a box of single colors, such as all blue, if they were packaged that way. As far as the pencils go, Crayola is our go-to brand in the classroom. They sharpen easily & don't have as much breakage as some brands. The colors are vibrant.

title: Unique & Fun New Game!
text:
Spontuneous is a fresh, clever & fun new family board game. You start by coming up with a list of words. Each word needs to be found in a song. Then once a word (trigger word) is given, the first person to come up with the lyrics that uses that words (in a phrase/line of at least 5 words) gets to roll the dice & advance. My 14 year old daughter LOVED the game. Even after our game was finished, she begged us to keep throwing out trigger words for her. She can't wait to play it with her friends. My 17 year old son is not a fan of most family games and although he did play with us, he couldn't wait to finish. He claimed that he didn't know enough songs to play. My husband & I both enjoyed it, though we did find that the 15 second allotment was hard at times. The directions weren't too complicated which was a big plus! There are challenge cards to get if you land on a certain spot. There was one penalty card which you could use if you caught someone on their cell phone! The game is designed for 4-10 players and is relatively short with games lasting about 30 minutes. It was interesting how we would all come up with different songs for each trigger word!

*I received the game for the purpose of trying out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Well made!
text: I ordered 4 sets for the last day of marching band camp. I gave one to all of the Senior students to celebrate the end of their very last year of camp. They were a huge hit! I was a little concerned about their quality after reading some of the other reviews, but we did not have any troubles with them. I considered ordering smaller ones, but I'm glad I decided on the 7 1./2 inch ones instead. They were the perfect size and they did an excellent job of annoying the band moms! Ours only came in 2 different color combinations - we had green/orange ones and blue/pink ones. I would  definitely order these again!

title: My husband is having a lot of fun with his quad copter!
text: I purchased this for my husband for Christmas. All he said was that he wanted a "Quad -Copter with a Video Camera". I looked through several different descriptions before deciding on this one. For the price, he was very happy with it. He said the instructions weren't very clear. When he was assembling it, he looked here on Amazon at the other reviews and learned that there was a propeller guard included on the bottom of the packaging. He said that the instructions didn't mention that at all and he was glad he read about it online before throwing that out. The battery charge is about 5 minutes or so, but he says that's pretty normal & he is already looking into extra batteries. The quality of video has been quite acceptable. Nothing as good as what you would get with a handheld device, but more than adequate. He has enjoyed filming the pets with his. We live in a 3 story home and the copter has successfully flown outside above the house without any difficulties.

title: Great 1st Baby Doll!
text: I purchased this for my 1 year old niece for Christmas. I was not happy with the "first" dolls out there. Most of them just aren't very cute at all!  Baby Stella is adorable! She is soft & cuddly. The pacifier is a neat feature. My now 13 year old would have loved that when she was younger. I love Stella's hair! My niece wears her hair the same way.

title: Fun to Use!
text: Liquid Chalk Markers are so fun to use! Even though these are thick markers, I was still able to use just an edge of the chiseled tip to write on a small chalkboard label without any problem. Once primed, the liquid chalk flows quickly.  I'm having fun writing messages on the mirror to my daughter. Easy clean up with just water. So much easier to clean than special glass/window markers that I purchased at the store.

title: CANVAS BAG SHOWN IS NOT WHAT YOU GET
text: What is pictured- a sturdy looking canvas case- is not what I received. What I received was an extremely cheap looking bag made out of a thin, slick plastic material, sort of like a very sheer poncho material. And the Melody Harp logo was sewn poorly and was puckering. The only good thing about it is that it fits my Melody Harp. It is cheap looking and clearly won't last, not worth anywhere near $13.50.  I am VERY annoyed that I have to go to the trouble of returning it!

title: Great Garage!
text:
My grandson got this garage from my husband and me for his 3rd birthday and he LOVED it! He loved the elevator especially. We got him 5 Matchbox cars to go with it because the reviews said that they would fit in the elevator, they did. Also he loved sending the cars down the ramps.A car sent from the top will continuing going of it's own power until it gets to the bottom. These were the two reasons I chose the Melissa and Doug. I also researched the Plan Toys and the Hape garages. Neither of those two allowed a car to go from the top to the bottom on its own. Also, the Plan Toys one had a small elevator and other cars including matchbox cars won't fit. In addition the gas pump was under the garage and looked hard to reach. The Hape garage looked thinner and less sturdy. And it sounded like the elevator was on the small side. The Melissa and Doug appears very sturdy, I will give an update in a few months to see how it holds up with my grandson and his two siblings playing with it. They are a very rambunctious lot.
My only concern was whether or not it would be hard to assemble.. There were a number of reviews complaining of misaligned screw holes, bags of screws missing, etc. I ordered it knowing it would arrive the day of my grandson's birthday, so I took a chance. I guess we got lucky because it arrived with no pieces missing and no defects that would make assembling hard or impossible. My husband said it was not a problem, it took him about a half an hour! AWESOME!

title: Accidentally went through the dishwasher!
text: I purchased several of the Plan Toy food sets for my grandchildren for Christmas and they loved them all. They especially loved the breakfast set: cracking the egg, salting the food, and serving it. The set is very cute. I also found that it is very durable! One morning I found the salt shaker in the dishwasher with my clean dishes. It went through the hot wash and dry cycle and came through unscathed! No paint loss, and the shaker still makes a shaking sound! Hats off to Plan Toys!

title: Quality craftsmanship
text: I was really skeptical about purchasing this item.  You know how it is......another really expensive toy that will probably break in some way or another in the first week.  But let me tell you,  I am so happy I purchased this item. I had my eye on the smaller version but last minute went with this instead. The box arrived with no additional packaging which kind of bummed me out because our postal carriers don't care about packages and thieves look for this kind of thing on porches.  Everything was intact upon delivery.  Opened the box. Easy to follow instructions.  But read them. Go step by step. Its easy but the pieces don't ready come apart easily after assembly. That's my favorite part of this toy! My children cannot pull it apart! The overall construction is very nice. Thick plastic. Easy motion for the moving parts. Sounds are good.  There are a lot of interactive parts and My kids have been enjoying it. Comes with Marshall dog and two pup packs. Also Chase dog, vehicle, and two additional pup packs. Chase's vehicle is NOT like the other pawpatrol vehicles that go with this set. The Chase vehicle doesn't have any moving parts.  The vehicles sold separately all have some special moving part on them.  This does not. My children noticed. Yours will too. Bummer.  Also, my children have a difficult time reaching the periscope with their feet on the floor. They might still be a little young.....  Overall great toy. Entertaining, even to me. Quality.

title: Not for the causal Nerf Gun player.
text:
First thing worth noting is that the rifle will jam if you're not familiar with using it. And if it jams, don't expect to reuse the bullet it got jammed on. But there is a good excuse for this

That being, this rifle works a lot like a real bolt action firearm, or at least compared to the pump action rifles which I find are kinda a silly concept as pumping a rifle to get it to fire is very unrealistic.

I won't spoil how to use the gun but I can say you have to get a feel for the method of firing it before you can go running around the park like a madman shooting it at random children(EG: not a toy for kids who can't get past the rifle's complexity. get them a gun that works similar to the night finder if they are too young to figure out stuff like this or have low attention spans).

Now getting passed getting used to the gun, it's hella entertaining to use. whether you use the stock and fill it with two quick reload clips to give you extra ammo, or you go with the barrel extension and the flip grenade launcher style sight, or if you're a madman like me you go without the stock or the barrel and just go rambo with it using a drum magazine(this is definitely a nerf gun you'll want extensions from other nerf guns on, by the way), you are bound to have hella fun times with it.

Just don't put the stock in unless you want to keep it in for a while, as the only way to get it out is too unscrew the back of the gun and lift it out.

Now, the down side to the gun is that it has a weak range for a "sniper," which is estimated 25-35 feet, depending on if you use the barrel extension or not. However, a cheap way to bring that up to 30-40 feet is to tape down the unjamming door and air release thingies on the sides of where the clips go with clear household tape. This will give the gun more pressure and make this a very very good mid range rifle. That mixed with the realistic feel of a real rifle, it's definitely worth it for the older, more dedicated nerf fans.

Bottom Line:
Pros:
-Realistic feeling that requires a more professional handing.
-Good for customization with other nerf accessories.
-Overall quality mid range nerf rifle.

Cons:
-Hard on casual/beginner users and those who have very little respect for the toy (EG not for little kids)
-Can really mess with ammo if you jam the gun.
-Stock is semi permanent and you're technically not supposed to remove the stock anyways. (Best to decide before you put it in if you want it to have a stock or not)
-Shorter range then marketed for. (I wouldn't hold this against the toy itself as everything is over marketed these days. The rifle is for midrange and is meant to be realistic, it's not supposed to be a super sniper that you can running around firing the bullets 70 feet away from you without going into an ark. Not even the Elite rifles do that.)

Disclaimer: I do not recommend that the people who buy this product do modifications to the gun that require opening it or removing screws. The only modification I recommended was the one about putting tape over the external holes that lead to where the bullets go, which does not involve any tampering of the hardware internally and hence does not count as an illegal modification. I hope any moderators understand I have no intent of breaking Hasbro or Amazon regulations. Thank you.

title: Check the positive battery holder terminals
text:
Like many others I owned the original Radio Shack version of this 130-in-1 electronics kit decades ago. True, this Elenco version isn't very sturdy. It's light and flimsy. But the overall layout, components, and experiments you can wire together are about the same. The 159-page real paper manual that comes with it is a plus (the PDF is also available for download from Elenco's web site). Each experiment has an overview, a schematic, and wiring connection-by-numbers instructions. Many useful and educational analog circuit designs are included (plus one digital gate logic IC). No microprocessor, computer, smart phone, or software updates required. Yea!!!

OK, now the quality issues. The first experiments I correctly wired together didn't work at all. I installed two different sets of 6AA batteries (Amazon Rechargeable then Duracell Alkaline). Still nothing. I returned the first one back to Amazon, got a replacement the next day. Both had the same problem. Both had a sticker with Date Code 0119. Hmmmm, manufactured the same day, same problem. I did some basic troubleshooting to try to figure out the problem.

It turns out the design or manufacture of the battery holder is defective. There is a gap of about 1mm between the + side of each battery and terminals in the holder. Two small plastic tabs at that location prevented the battery connection from being made. My "fix" was to jam a wadded up piece of copper tape to fill the gap at each of the 6 positive battery terminals to complete the battery circuit (aluminum foil would work fine too). Hopefully Elenco will crack the whip at the Chinese factory to fix this, or they'll see a lot of returns for this very simple and silly defect. Check recent reviews to see if the problem has been fixed in newer batches from the factory.

If you don't have a voltmeter, you can construct a simple circuit to see if power from the batteries is making it to the front panel. Install the batteries and try lighting up the decimal point of the digital display by connecting: 25-121,24-119 or 25-124,24-122

Most of the experiments I've tried so far worked. But the AM radio receiver circuits are iffy. The only one I could make work was #113: Two-Transistor Radio. I used the supplied long green wire raised up high as the antenna. The signal levels seem too low to work for #112: Crystal Set Radio and #109: Operational Amplifier AM Radio.

Quality issues aside, I'm keeping it. I'm having too much fun with it. And I have great respect for the designers who created the original analog circuits that can be recreated using this kit.
